muneralis: <entryFree id="n29980" type="main" key="mu_ne^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĕrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>munus</etym>, <sense id="n29980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to presents</hi> (ante- and post-class.): lex, <hi rend="ital">by which advocates were forbidden to receive presents</hi> (the Cincian law; v. Cincius), Plaut. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=143" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 143</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
munerarius: <entryFree id="n29981" type="main" key="mu_ne^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n29981.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a gift</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 6, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29981.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to gladiatorial exhibitions</hi> (a word first used by Augustus, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 34</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n29981.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: libellus, Trebell. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 5, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29981.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n29981.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">One who bestows gifts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 66, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29981.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The giver of a gladiatorial exhibition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thracem mirmilloni parem, munerario imparem dixerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4 praef.</bibl>; Inscr Orell. 1185; 2534; 2585; 3746.</sense></entryFree>
muneratio: <entryFree id="n29982" type="main" key="mu_ne^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>munero</etym>, <sense id="n29982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a giving, presenting</hi> (post-class.). necessaria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
munerator: <entryFree id="n29983" type="main" key="mu_ne^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the giver of a gladiatorial exhibition</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:20:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 20, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
munerigerulus: <entryFree id="n29984" type="hapax" key="mu_ne^ri^ge^ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĕrĭ-gĕrŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>munusgero</etym>, <sense id="n29984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearer of presents</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 48</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">muniferi, damnigeruli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit> Speng.</sense></entryFree>
munero:
<entryFree id="n29985" type="main" key="mu_ne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">moen-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĕror</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype> (v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:12:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 12, 20</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>munus</etym>, <sense id="n29985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give, bestow, present</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">to present, honor, reward with</hi> a thing (rare but class.; syn.: dono, largior, impertion. </sense><sense id="n29985.1" n="I" level="1"> Form munero, with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: cujus exuvias et coronam huic muneravit virgini, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 499, 11</bibl>: Kalendis suam matrem. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Horolen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:28" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 28</bibl></cit> (Trag. Rel. v. 446 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to render</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 477, 19</bibl>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quibus rex te munerare constituerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: inani me, inquis, lance muneras. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 119:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 119, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:20:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 20, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Trojano locupletissime muneratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier munerata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1176" /> <cb n="MUNI" /> 4: <cit><quote lang="la">legatus muneratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">gerundive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non meretriculis moenerandis rem coëgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 55</bibl></cit> Speng.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">at certatim nutricant et munerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni eum societate muneravit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignus quem maximis officiis muneres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:104" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 104</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n29985.2" n="II" level="1"> Form muneror: <cit><quote lang="la">natura aliud alii muneratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assectatur, assidet, muneratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 5, 2, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 59</bibl> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">Fleck. demunerarier): Alexis me opipare muneratus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:20" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herm. Trim. 11</bibl>.</sense>
‡ *<orth extent="full" lang="la">mungo</orth>, <itype>ere</itype> <etym>obsolete, the orig. form whence emungo, mucus, mucere, mucor, mucedo; cf. Sanscr. muk, to let go, throw off; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)pomu/ssw</foreign>, to wipe away; <foreign lang="greek">mukth/r</foreign>, nose; <foreign lang="greek">mu/ca</foreign>, snivel</etym>, <sense id="n29985.3" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to blow the nose</hi>: mungo, <foreign lang="greek">mu/ssw</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
munia: <entryFree id="n29986" type="main" key="mu_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭa</orth> (archaic form <orth extent="full" lang="la">moenia</orth>: moenia praeter aedificia significant etiam et munia, hoc est officia, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=151" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 151</bibl> Müll.), ōrum (class. only in the form munia, <case>nom.</case> and <case>acc.</case>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root mū, bind; that to which one is bound; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)mu/nw</foreign>; also moenia, murus, munus, immunis, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n29986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">duties, functions</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">official</hi> or <hi rend="ital">professional duties</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: officia, munera): munia candidatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 35, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui suis cervicibus tanta munia atque rem publicam sustinent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:66:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 66, 138</bibl></cit>: cuncti omnium ordinum extrema munia sequi, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 137, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli pacisque munia facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatūs, magistratuum, legum in se trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">munia consulatūs obire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munia ducis implere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae servare munia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 131</bibl></cit>. —Post-class. forms, <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: OB HAEC INSIGNIA GENERA MVNIORVM, Inscr. Spon. Miscell. Antiq. p. 36 (A. D. 394), but <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> muniūm, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 11</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> munibus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 3, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">muniis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 12, 559</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 10, 8 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
munica: <entryFree id="n29987" type="gloss" key="mu_ni^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭca</orth>, <itype>pro communicas dicebant</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=152" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 152</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
municeps: <entryFree id="n29988" type="main" key="mu_ni^ceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭ-ceps</orth>, <itype>ĭpis</itype> (<sense id="n29988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi>, municipium for municipum, Tab. Heracl. ap. Mazoch. line 71), <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>munia-capio, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr></etym>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of a</hi> municipium or <hi rend="ital">free town, a burgher, citizen</hi> (class.): municeps, qui in municipio liber natus est. Item, qui ex alio genere hominum munus functus est. Item qui in municipio a servitute se liberavit a municipe. Item municipes erant, qui ex aliis civitatibus Romam venissent, quious non licebat magistratum capere, sed tantum muneris partem, ut fuerunt Cumani, Acerrani, Atellani, qui et cives Romani erant, et in legione merebant, sed dignitates non capiebant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=131" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 131</bibl> Müll. (v. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">municipes sunt cives Romani ex municipiis, legibus suis et suo jure utentes: muneris tantum cum populo Romano honorarii participes: a quo munere capessendo appellati videntur, nullis aliis necessitatibus, neque ullā populi Romani lege astricti, nisi, inquam, populus eorum fundus factus est. Primos autem municipes sine suffragii jure Caerites esse factos, accepimus: concessumque illis, ut civitatis Romanae honorem quidem caperent, sed negotiis tamen atque oneribus vacarent, pro sacris bello Gallico receptis custoditisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:13:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: municeps Cosanus, <hi rend="ital">a citizen of</hi> (the municipium of) <hi rend="ital">Cosa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:62:section=161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 62, § 161</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29988.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29988.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fellow-citizen, fellowcountryman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">municeps noster,</quote> <trans><tr>our fellowcountryman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:70:246" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 70, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amavit Glyceram municipem suam,</quote> <trans><tr>his fellow-countrywoman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 125</bibl></cit>: di municipes, <hi rend="ital">a term applied in contempt to those deities who were confined to particular localities</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videmus gentiles deos colere municipes, ut Eleusinios Cererem, Phrygas Matrem, Epidaurios Aesculapium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of fishes: <cit><quote lang="la">vendere municipes siluros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:33" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 33</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. things: municipes Jovis advexisse lagenas, <hi rend="ital">bottles, the countrymen of Jove</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Cretan bottles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:271" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 271</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29988.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A freedman in a</hi> municipium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 1, 1</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 23</bibl> and 27.</sense></entryFree>
municipalis: <entryFree id="n29989" type="main" key="mu_ni^ci^pa_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭ-cĭpālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>municipium</etym>, <sense id="n29989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a</hi> municipium, <hi rend="ital">municipal</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">est enim ipse, a materno geuere, municipalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: dolor, <cb n="MUNI" /> i. e. municipum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 11, 4</bibl>.—As the municipia were subordinate to the capital cities, the term is sometimes used in a contemptuous sense, analagous to our <hi rend="ital">provincial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">municipalis eques (of Cicero),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:236" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">municipalis harenae perpetui comites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">municipales et cathedrarii oratores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. 9, 310</bibl></cit>: municipalia sacra vocantur, quae ab initio habuerunt ante civitatem Romanam acceptam, quae observare eos voluerunt Pontifices, et eo more facere, quo adfuissent (assuessent) antiquitus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=157" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 157</bibl> Müll.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭcĭpā-lĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a</hi> municipium (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">municipaliter natus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
municipatim: <entryFree id="n29990" type="main" key="mu_ni^ci^pa_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭcĭpātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>municipium</etym>, <sense id="n29990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by</hi> municipia (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">municipatim dividendos censuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 14 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
municipatio: <entryFree id="n29991" type="main" key="mu_ni^ci^pa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭcĭpātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>municeps</etym>, <sense id="n29991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">citizenship</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Psa. 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
municipatus: <entryFree id="n29992" type="main" key="mu_ni^ci^pa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭcĭpātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">citizenship</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <foreign lang="greek">poli/teuma</foreign>, id est municipatus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3702</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
municipiolum: <entryFree id="n29993" type="main" key="mu_ni^ci^pi^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭcĭpĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>municipium</etym>, <sense id="n29993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little</hi> municipium (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
municipium: <entryFree id="n29994" type="main" key="mu_ni^ci^pi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭcĭpĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>municeps</etym>, <sense id="n29994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town, particularly in Italy, which possessed the right of Roman citizenship</hi> (<hi rend="ital">together with, in most cases, the right of voting</hi>), <hi rend="ital">but was governed by its own laws; a free town</hi> (cf. municeps; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: civitas, oppidum): Sex. Roscius, pecuniā sui municipii facile primus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum erat Italiae municipium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e municipio antiquissimo Tusculano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 8, 19</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes for colonia: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Castronius longe princeps municipii Lucensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 13 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
munidator: <entryFree id="n29995" type="main" key="mu_ni^da^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭdător</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>munus-dator</etym>, <sense id="n29995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bestower of gifts</hi>, Inscr. Afran. ap. Renier, 2928.</sense></entryFree>
munifex: <entryFree id="n29996" type="main" key="mu_ni^fex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭfex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>com.</gen> <etym>munia-facio</etym>, <sense id="n29996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who performs service</hi> or <hi rend="ital">is on duty</hi> (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n29996.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of soldiers: <cit><quote lang="la">munifices, milites, qui munera facere coguntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. BENEFICIARII, p. 33 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n29996.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">munifex mamma,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>suckling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 40, 95, § 234</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
munifice: <entryFree id="n29997" type="main" key="mu_ni^fi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭfĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. munificus <sense id="n29997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
munificens: <entryFree id="n29998" type="main" key="mu_ni^fi^cens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭfĭcens</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. munificus.</entryFree>
munificentia: <entryFree id="n29999" type="main" key="mu_ni^fi^centi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭfĭcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>munificus</etym>, <sense id="n29999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bountifulness, munificence, liberality, generosity</hi> (class., but not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar beneficiis ac munificentiā magnus habebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 54:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitatem et munificentiam exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:5:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
munificium: <entryFree id="n30000" type="main" key="mu_ni^fi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭfĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>munus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n30000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subjection to public burdens</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:4:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 4, § 1</bibl> (al. munificum).</sense></entryFree>
munifico: <entryFree id="n30001" type="hapax" key="mu_ni^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>munificus</etym>, <sense id="n30001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to present with</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 625</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
munificus: <entryFree id="n30002" type="main" key="mu_ni^fi^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>munusfacio</etym>, <sense id="n30002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">present-making</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">bountiful, liberal, benevolent, generous, munificent</hi> (class.; syn.: liberalis, beneficus). </sense><sense id="n30002.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">ut munifica sim bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dando munificum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 18, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalissimus munificentissimusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 8, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30002.2" n="II" level="1"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:1:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:38:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 38, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: munificior a munifico identidem Cato dixit, cum nunc munificentior dicamus, quamvis munificens non sit in usu, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=155" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 155</bibl> Müll.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭ-fĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">bountifully, munificently</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tam munifice et tam large dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:27:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 27, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjuvisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30003" type="main" key="mu_ni^fi^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>munia-facio</etym>, <sense id="n30003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">doing duty, on duty</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">munifici milites (al. munifices),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
munimen: <entryFree id="n30004" type="main" key="mu_ni_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnīmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. munio</etym>, <sense id="n30004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a defence, fortification, rampart, enclosure</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">munimen ad imbres,</quote> <trans><tr>a defence against the rains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossas munimine cingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrat esse locum, solidae tutum munimine molis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:771" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 771</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clausae portae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horti,</quote> <trans><tr>a fence, hedge</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 24, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
munimentum: <entryFree id="n30005" type="main" key="mu_ni_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnīmentum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">moen-</orth>, <itype>archaic form</itype>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:32:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 32, 106</bibl> B. and K.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a defence, fortification, intrenchment,<cb n="MUNI" />  rampart, bulwark, protection</hi> (class. but not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n30005.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut instar muri hae sepes munimenta praeberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossa, haud parvum munimentum, a planioribus aditu locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:37" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 37</bibl></cit>.—Esp., of military <hi rend="ital">fortifications, intrenchments</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenere se munimentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domūs munimentis septae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munimentis se defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coërcere intra munimenta militem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munimenta perrumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni, i. e. flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—Of a <hi rend="ital">defence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">covering</hi> for the body: <cit><quote lang="la">munimentum ipsis equisque loricae plumatae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingues aliquando lacernas, munimenta togae accipimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:28" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30005.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">defence, protection, shelter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id munimentum (Horatium Coclem) illo die fortuna urbis Romanae habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rati, noctem sibi munimento fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 97:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 97, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munimento foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 50:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 50, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones firma imperii munimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3</bibl></cit> prooem.; 2, 1, 5.</sense></entryFree>
munio: <entryFree id="n30006" type="main" key="mu_ni^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnĭo</orth> (old form moenio, v. below), īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4 (<sense id="n30006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> munibis for munies, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 10, 5</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>moenia, lit. to wall; hence</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to build a wall around, to defend with a wall, to fortify, defend, protect, secure, put in a state of defence</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n30006.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcem ad urbem obsidendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 24, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpibus Italiam munierat ante natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum praesidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra vallo fossāque,</quote> <trans><tr>with palisades and a trench</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum muro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 29</bibl></cit>.—With a homogeneous object, prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">magna moenis moenia,</quote> <trans><tr>you are undertaking a great thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duovir urbis moeniendae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 7142</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: quod idoneum ad muniendum putarent, <hi rend="ital">for fortifying</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">for use in the fortifications</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:31" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 31</bibl>. —Also, <hi rend="ital">to surround, guard</hi>, for the protection of other things: ignem ita munire ut non evagaretur, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 12, 7, 7.—</sense><sense id="n30006.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30006.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to defend, guard, secure, protect, shelter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pergamum divinā moenitum manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortum ab incursu hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spica contra avium morsūs munitur vallo aristarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hieme quaternis tunicis et tibialibus muniebatur,</quote> <trans><tr>he defended, protected, covered himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n30006.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make</hi> a road, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">to make passable</hi> by opening, repairing, or paving it: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi Appius Caecus viam munierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">TEMPE MVNIVIT,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 587</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n30006.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30006.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To guard, secure, strengthen, support</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fulcio, sustineo): meretriculis Muniendis rem cogere,</quote> <trans><tr>to maintain, support</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 54</bibl></cit> (dub.; Speng. moenerandis; v. munero).—<hi rend="ital">Am strengthening myself</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">munio me ad haec tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <trans><tr>to secure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muniri adversus fraudes,</quote> <trans><tr>to secure one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 13, 76, § 198</bibl></cit> (dub. moneri, Jahn): <cit><quote lang="la">se contra ruborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se multorum benevolentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:26:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 26, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se contra perfidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid auctoritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:127:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 127, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum terrore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:48:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 48, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30006.7" n="B" level="2"> Munire viam, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">open a way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia tibi accusandi viam muniebant,</quote> <trans><tr>prepared the way for your accusation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:23:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 23, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi viam ad stuprum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:25:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 25, § 64</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., defended, fortified, protected, secured, safe</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nullius pudicitia munita contra tuam cupiditatem et audaciam posset esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:15:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 15, § 39</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. plur</hi>. munita as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: munita viāi, <hi rend="ital">fortification</hi> or <hi rend="ital">breastwork</hi> of the mouth (cf. Homer. <foreign lang="greek">e(/rkos o)do/ntwn</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">the lips</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 498</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se munitiorem ad custodiendam vitam suam fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitissima castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 55</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnītē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">securely, safely</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">munitius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=141" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 141</bibl></cit>. Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30007" type="spur" key="muni^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">munĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis, a false reading for nomionem</itype>, v. Orell. and Klotz, ad h. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 251</bibl>.</entryFree>
munis: <entryFree id="n30008" type="main" key="mu_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. munus</etym>, <sense id="n30008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ready to be of service</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to oblige, obliging</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dico ejus pro meritis gratum me et munem fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 105</bibl></cit>: munifici munesque viri, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 23, 15</bibl>; cf.: munem<pb n="1177" /> <cb n="MUNU" />  significare ... officiosum: unde e contrario immunis dicitur, qui nullo fungitur officio, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=143" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 143</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
munite: <entryFree id="n30009" type="main" key="mu_ni_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnītē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. munio, <sense id="n30009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
munitio: <entryFree id="n30010" type="main" key="mu_ni_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. munio</etym>, <sense id="n30010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a defending, fortifying, protecting</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n30010.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites munitione prohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis,</quote> <trans><tr>a fortifying, erection of fortifications</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluminum,</quote> <trans><tr>a bridging over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitionis multa sunt genera,</quote> <trans><tr>enclosure, fencing, hedging</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30010.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30010.3" n="1" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a means of fortification</hi> or <hi rend="ital">defence, a fortification, rampart, bulwark, intrenchment, walls</hi> (syn. munimentum): <cit><quote lang="la">nisi munitione ac mole lapidum a mari (fons) disjunctus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitiones multiplices Piraei portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:23:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem operibus munitionibusque sepire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: demoliri, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 2, 204</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per munitionem introire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitiones in urbem spectantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitiones et castella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum munitionis,</quote> <trans><tr>of the walls</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30010.4" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to munio, I. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">A making passable</hi> of roads, by opening, paving, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex viarum munitione quaestum facere,</quote> <trans><tr>repairing the roads, work on the roads</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos ad munitiones viarum condemnavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30010.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a support</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus ad causam et munitio aut quoddam ornamentum,</quote> <trans><tr>support to the cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:79:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 79, 320</bibl></cit> (al. communitio).—(The gloss. of Fest. is prob. corrupt: munitio morsicatio ciborum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=143" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 143</bibl> Müll.)</sense></entryFree>
munitiuncula: <entryFree id="n30011" type="main" key="mu_ni_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnītĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>munitio</etym>, <sense id="n30011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little fortification</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 16, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
munito: <entryFree id="n30012" type="hapax" key="mu_ni_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnīto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>1. munio</etym>, <sense id="n30012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make passable, to open</hi> a road: <cit><quote lang="la">viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:48:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 48, 140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
munitor: <entryFree id="n30013" type="main" key="mu_ni_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortifier, a worker on fortifications, an engineer, miner</hi>, etc. (not in Cic. or Cæs.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui pro munitoribus armati steterant (al. munitionibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitorum numerus,</quote> <trans><tr>miners</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 19, 11</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Apollo, the builder of the walls of Troy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 139</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
munitrix: <entryFree id="n30014" type="main" key="mu_ni_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnītrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>munitor</etym>, <sense id="n30014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female fortifier</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1122</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
munitura: <entryFree id="n30015" type="main" key="mu_ni_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnītūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. munio</etym>, <sense id="n30015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a protection, enclosure</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n30015.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">SARCOPHAGI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 589, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30015.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an apron, leathern apron</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">perizw/mata</foreign>, quas vulgus etiam munituras vocat, Aug. ap. Jul. Pelag. 2, 6.</sense></entryFree>
munitus: <entryFree id="n30016" type="main" key="mu_ni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. 1. munio <sense id="n30016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
munus: <entryFree id="n30017" type="main" key="mu_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnus</orth> (old orthogr. moenus; <sense id="n30017.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">moenera militiaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 29</bibl></cit>), <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root mu-; cf.: moenia, munis, munia, etc.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a service, office, post, employment, function, duty</hi> (class.; syn.: officium, ministerium, honos). </sense><sense id="n30017.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: munus significat officium, cum dicitur quis munere fungi. Item donum quod officii causā datur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=140" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 140</bibl> Müll. (cf. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">munus curare,</quote> <trans><tr>to discharge an office</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">octo munus hominum fungi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">administrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus atque officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae,</quote> <trans><tr>a public office</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 45, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de jure respondendi sustinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:30:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 30, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae explere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigiliarum obire,</quote> <trans><tr>to perform</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officii,</quote> <trans><tr>the performance of a duty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 11, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuum est hoc munus, tuae partes: a te hoc civitas exspectat,</quote> <trans><tr>duty, office, obligation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principum est resistere levitati multitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 11, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30017.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., = onus, <hi rend="ital">a duty, burden, tribute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hoc munus imponebatur tam grave civitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:20:section=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 20, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quoque munus leve atque commune Mamertinis remisisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 21</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">52: dum ne quis eorum munere vacaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim detractionem eam munerum militiae, sed apertam defectionem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 9, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30017.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30017.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A work</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorum vigiliarum munus, Cic. Par. prooem.: solitudinis,</quote> <trans><tr>a work, book, written in solitude</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Off. 3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30017.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A service, favor</hi>: huc ire licet atque illuc munere ditium dominorum, Sall. Orat. Licin.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 11, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30017.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the last service, office</hi> to the dead, i. e. <hi rend="ital">burial</hi>: pro <cb n="MURC" /> hominis dignitate amplo munere extulit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 4, 4</bibl> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">al. funere): suprema,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supremum mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:101:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 101, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:313" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fungi inani Munere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:885" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 885</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cineri haec mittite nostro Munera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 624</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30017.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A present, gift</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">donum, praemium): bonum datum deorum concessu atque munere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittere aliquid alicui munere,</quote> <trans><tr>to send one something as a present</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 19, § 74</bibl></cit> (al. muneri): <cit><quote lang="la">quasi totam regionem muneri accepissent,</quote> <trans><tr>had received as a present</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem munere donare,</quote> <trans><tr>to present one with a gift</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare muneri aliquid alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to give one something as a present</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera Liberi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cereris,</quote> <trans><tr>bread</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gratae post munus aristae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:183" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem munere palpat Carus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a bribe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30017.8" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n30017.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A public show, spectacle, entertainment, exhibition</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a show of gladiators</hi>, which was given to the people by the magistrates, and generally by the ædiles, as an expression of gratitude for the honorable office to which they had been elected (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ludus, spectaculum): erat munus Scipionis, dignum et eo ipso et illo Q. Metello, cui dabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:58:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 58, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus magnificum dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 19, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">functus est aedilicio maximo munere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>gave a splendid exhibition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 16, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venationes, quae vocantur munera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera nunc edunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:36" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:18" default="NO">4, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30017.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A public building for the use of the people, erected at the expense of an individual</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeii munera,</quote> <trans><tr>the theatre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:130:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 130, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut ubi muneribus nati sua munera mater Addidit (i. e. theatro Marcelli porticum Octaviam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30017.11" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of the structure of the universe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effector vel moderator tanti operis et muneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
munusculum: <entryFree id="n30018" type="main" key="mu_nuscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūnuscŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>munus</etym>, <sense id="n30018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small present</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">amico munusculum levidense mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: nemini hoc deferre munusculum maluit, quam suo accusatori, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima munuscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exigit a te nulla munuscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:36" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
munychia: <entryFree id="n30019" type="main" key="Mu_ny^chi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūnychĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mounuxi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n30019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the port of Athens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2, 5</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mū-nychĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Munychian</hi>, poet for <hi rend="ital">Athenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 709</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
muraena: <entryFree id="n30020" type="greek" key="mu_raena1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūraena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. 1. Murena.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n30021" type="main" key="Mu_raena2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūraena</orth>, v. 2. Murena.</entryFree>
muralis: <entryFree id="n30022" type="main" key="mu_ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>murus</etym>, <sense id="n30022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a wall, wall-, mural</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">muralis herba,</quote> <trans><tr>the pellitory of the wall, parietary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 30, 104, § 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pila,</quote> <trans><tr>used in fighting from walls</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tormentum,</quote> <trans><tr>for battering walls</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:921" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 921</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossa,</quote> <trans><tr>under the walls</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:555" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 555</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falces,</quote> <trans><tr>hooks for pulling down walls</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: corona, <hi rend="ital">a mural crown</hi>, given as a reward to him who first scaled the enemy's walls, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 18</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <trans><tr>the crown on the head of Cybele, adorned with walls and towers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 606</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
muralium: <entryFree id="n30023" type="main" key="mu_ra_li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūrālĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n30023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> muralis herba, parthenium, <hi rend="ital">and</hi> perdicium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 30, 104, § 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
murana: <entryFree id="n30024" type="main" key="mu_ra_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūrāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (eccl. Lat.): super acervum stercoris atque muranam sedens Anon. (Hilar.) in Job, 2, p. 167; 2, p. 181; 3, p. 214 (Fr. moraine, a heap of stones; Sp. moron, a hill).</entryFree>
muratus: <entryFree id="n30025" type="main" key="mu_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>murus</etym>, <sense id="n30025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">walled, surrounded</hi> or <hi rend="ital">defended by walls</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 8</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
murceus: <entryFree id="n30026" type="gloss" key="murce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n30026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., slow, sluggish, inactive</hi>: murcei, <foreign lang="greek">nwqei=s</foreign>, Vet. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
murcia: <entryFree id="n30027" type="main" key="Murci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Murcĭa</orth> (also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Murtia, Murtea</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Myrtea</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n30027.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An epithet of Venus, said to be taken from the myrtle, which was sacred to her</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=154" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 154</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 36, § 121</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30027.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The goddess of sloth</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 16; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 132</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Her temple was at the foot of the Aventine, which was formerly called</hi> Murcus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=148" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 148</bibl>; cf. murcidus.</sense></entryFree>
murcidus: <entryFree id="n30028" type="main" key="murci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murcĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>murcus</etym>, <sense id="n30028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slothful</hi> (ante-class.): dea Murcia, quae praeter modum non moveret, ac faceret hominem, ut ait Pomponius murcidum, id est nimis <cb n="MURI" /> desidiosum, et inactuosum, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 16; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
murciolus: <entryFree id="n30029" type="main" key="murci^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murcĭŏlus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">murcĕŏlus</orth>, v. myrteolus.</entryFree>
murcius: <entryFree id="n30030" type="main" key="Murci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Murcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Murtĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Murcia, Murtia</etym>, <sense id="n30030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sacred to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">called after Venus Murcia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Murciae or Murtiae metae (sc. in Circo)), so named because near the chapel of the goddess Murcia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 176, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vallis,</quote> <trans><tr>the valley in which her temple stood</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 404</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 636</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
murcus: <entryFree id="n30031" type="main" key="murcus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coward, who, to escape military service, cuts off his thumb</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 12, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30032" type="main" key="Murcus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Murcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. L. Statius Murcus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 12, 30</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n30032.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The old name of the Aventine Hill</hi>, acc. to Paul. ex Fest. s. v. Murciae deae, p. 148 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
murena: <entryFree id="n30033" type="main" key="Murena1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Murena</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Muraena</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu/raina</foreign>. <sense id="n30033.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The murena</hi>, a fish of which the ancients were very fond, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 55, 81, § 171</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">muraenam exdorsua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:99" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 99</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n30033.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a black stripe in the shape of this fish, a black vein in the table-tops of citron-wood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 15, 30, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30034" type="main" key="Murena2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Murena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (ante-class form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Muraena</orth>, but without class. authority), <sense id="n30034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname in the</hi> gens Licinia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16</bibl>.—So, </sense><sense id="n30034.1" n="1" level="3"> L. Licinius Murena, <hi rend="ital">who was defended by Cicero, in an oration still extant, against the charge of</hi> ambitus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 7, 15</bibl>, etc.—</sense><sense id="n30034.2" n="2" level="3"> A. Terentus Varro Murena, <hi rend="ital">an intimate friend of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 12, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 22, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30034.3" n="3" level="3"> L. Licinius Varro Murena, <hi rend="ital">brother-in-law of Mæcenas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 38</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mū-renĭānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Mūraen-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Murænd, Murænian</hi>: oratio, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that pronounced by Cicero on behalf of</hi> L. Licinius Murena, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, 172, § 525</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
murenula: <entryFree id="n30035" type="main" key="mu_re_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūrēnŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mūraen-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. murena</etym>. <sense id="n30035.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small murena</hi> (late Lat.): murenulam strictis manibus tenere, Hier. praef. in Job.—</sense><sense id="n30035.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a small necklace resembling a murena</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum colli sui, quod quidem murenulam vulgus vocat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 24, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Isa. 2, 3, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
murex: <entryFree id="n30036" type="main" key="mu_rex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūrex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n30036.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The purple-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 36, 60, § 125</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 299, 11</bibl> (Heduph. v. 11, p. 167 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">Baianus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 32</bibl></cit>.—The Tritons used the shell as a tuba, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:726" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 726</bibl>.—The shells were also used for holding liquids, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:27" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 27</bibl>.—And for adorning grottos: <cit><quote lang="la">summa lacunabant alterno murice conchae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 563</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30036.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30036.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The purple dye, purple</hi>, made from the juice of the purple-fish: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrioque ardebat murice laena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 262</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30036.3" n="B" level="2"> Of bodies shaped (pointed) like the purplefish. </sense><sense id="n30036.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A pointed rock</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acuto in murice remi Obnixi crepuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato sternendum forum muricibus censuerat,</quote> <trans><tr>with small, pointed stones</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 6, § 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30036.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sharp murex-shell used for a bridle-bit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acuto murice frenat Delphinas bijuges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">221</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30036.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A caltrop</hi>, with sharp points in every direction: <cit><quote lang="la">murices ferreos in terram defodisse Dareum, quā hostem equites emissurum esse credebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:36" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30036.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A spike</hi> of iron: <cit><quote lang="la">armarium muricibus praefixum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
murgantia: <entryFree id="n30037" type="main" key="Murganti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Murgantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n30037.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Samnium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Baselice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 17, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30037.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Sicily, also called</hi> Murgentia, now perh. <hi rend="ital">Mandri Bianchi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:21:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 21, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 27, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:266" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 266</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30037.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Murgan-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Murgantia</hi> (in Samnium), <hi rend="ital">Murgantian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">POPVLVS MVRGANTIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 141</bibl></cit>: Romanelli, Topogr. Napol. t. 2, p. 481.—</sense><sense id="n30037.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mur-gentīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Murgant-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Murgantia</hi> (in Sicily), <hi rend="ital">Murgantine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18, § 47</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Murgentīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Murgantia, Murgantines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:43:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 43, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
murgiso: <entryFree id="n30038" type="gloss" key="murgiso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murgiso</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crafty advocate</hi>: murgisonem dixerunt a morā et decisione, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=144" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 144</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
muria: <entryFree id="n30039" type="main" key="mu^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭrĭes</orth>, ēi. v infra), <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a(lmuoi/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n30039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">salt liquor, brine</hi>, <pb n="1178" /> <cb n="MURM" /> <hi rend="ital">pickle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleae conduntur vel virides in muriā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oleae ex muriā durā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut melius muriā, quam testa marina remittat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 53</bibl></cit>.—Form muries, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 88, 2</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=158 sq" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 158 sq.</bibl> Müll.; Fab. Pict. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 223, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
muriaticus: <entryFree id="n30040" type="main" key="mu^ri^a_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭrĭātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>muria</etym>, <sense id="n30040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pickled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lying in brine;</hi> perh. only as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭrĭātĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a pickled fish</hi> (Plautinian), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(coqua) scit, muriatica ut maceret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
muricatim: <entryFree id="n30041" type="main" key="mu_ri^ca_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūrĭcātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>murex</etym>, <sense id="n30041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the shape of a purple-fish</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vertice muricatim intorto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 162</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
muricatus: <entryFree id="n30042" type="main" key="mu_ri^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūrĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shaped like a purple-fish, pointed</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30042.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia spinosa, muricatis cacuminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 23, 99, § 262</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30042.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (acc. to murex, II. B. 3.), <hi rend="ital">fearful, timid</hi>, as if walking over caltrops: <cit><quote lang="la">gressus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
