muriceus: <entryFree id="n30043" type="main" key="mu_ri^ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūrĭcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a purple-fish, pointed, full of points, rough</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lacunae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 9, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
muricidus: <entryFree id="n30044" type="main" key="mu_ri^ci_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūrĭcīdus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">murric-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. mus-caedo, mouse-killer</etym>, <sense id="n30044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coward, poltroon</hi>, as a term of abuse: <cit><quote lang="la">vae tibi muricide homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=125" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 125</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
muriculus: <entryFree id="n30045" type="main" key="mu_ri^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūrĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>murex</etym>, <sense id="n30045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small purple-fish</hi> (ante-class.), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 299, 11</bibl> (Heduph. v. 11 Vahl. p. 167).</sense></entryFree>
muricus: <entryFree id="n30046" type="main" key="mu_ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūrĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mus</etym>, <sense id="n30046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mouser</hi>: poëta non musicus, sed muricus, Ven. Fort. praef. L<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, p. 31</bibl> Brower.</sense></entryFree>
muries: <entryFree id="n30047" type="main" key="mu^ri^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭrĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, v. muria.</entryFree>
murilegulus: <entryFree id="n30048" type="main" key="mu_ri^le^gu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūrĭ-lĕgŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>murex-legulus</etym>, <sense id="n30048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who gathers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fishes for the purple-fish</hi> (post-class.), Cod. Th. 10, 20, 5; 14 sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 7, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
murinus: <entryFree id="n30049" type="main" key="mu_ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mus</etym>, <sense id="n30049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of mice, mouse-</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): murinus color, <hi rend="ital">mouse-color</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 13, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Sat. Men. 63:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Sat. Men. 63, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 9, 23, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 6, 34, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 6, 36, § 113</bibl></cit>: pelles, <hi rend="ital">the skins of martens, ermines</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:2:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordeum,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of wild barley</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 65, § 135</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
murmillo: <entryFree id="n30050" type="main" key="murmillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murmillo</orth>, v. mirmillo.</entryFree>
murmur: <entryFree id="n30051" type="main" key="murmur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murmur</orth>, <itype>ŭris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>: murmur fit verus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 214, 14</bibl>) [Sanscr. marmara, susurrus, murmur, and the Greek <foreign lang="greek">mormu/rw</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">murmu/rw</foreign>], <sense id="n30051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a murmur, murmuring; a humming, roaring, growling, grumbling; a rushing, crashing</hi>, etc. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: fremitus, strepitus, fragor, stridor, susurrus): murmur populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 1</bibl></cit>: serpitque per agmina murmur. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 239</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto porrexit murmure panem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:67" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 67</bibl></cit>.—Of prayer, <hi rend="ital">a low, indistinct tone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ubi placavit precibus et murmure longo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 251</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:290" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 290</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the humming</hi> of bees: <cit><quote lang="la">strepit omnis murmure campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 709</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the roar</hi> of a lion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:55:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 55, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the tiger: tigridis Hyrcanae jejunum murmur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:170" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 170</bibl></cit>.—Of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">a murmur, roar, rushing, crashing, crash, rumbling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam et odor urbanitatis, et mollitudo humanitatis, et murmur maris, et dulcedo orationis sunt ducta a ceteris sensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:40:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 40, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to roar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno misceri murmure caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventosum,</quote> <trans><tr>the rushing wind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 9, 58</bibl></cit>.—Of thunder: <cit><quote lang="la">exanimes primo murmure caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:224" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 224</bibl></cit>.—Of a volcanic mountain: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetnaei verticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 51</bibl></cit>.—Of an earthquake, <hi rend="ital">a roaring, rumbling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecedit sonus, alias murmuri similis, alias mugitibus, aut clamori humano, armorumve pulsantium fragori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 80, 82, § 193</bibl></cit>.—Of wind-instruments: <cit><quote lang="la">cornuum,</quote> <trans><tr>the sound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: inflati buxi, <hi rend="ital">of the</hi> tibia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 537</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurium,</quote> <trans><tr>a singing in the ears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 7, 21, § 75</bibl></cit> (Jahn, animalia).—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemnere murmura famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:5:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 5, 29</bibl></cit>; of a <hi rend="ital">muttering, rebellious murmur</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra Dominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 16, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 6, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
murmurabundus: <entryFree id="n30052" type="main" key="murmu^ra_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murmŭrābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>murmuro</etym>, <sense id="n30052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">murmuring</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 123, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
murmuratio: <entryFree id="n30053" type="main" key="murmu^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murmŭrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a murmuring, crying</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">aquilarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum sine murmuratione comitari,</quote> <trans><tr>without murmuring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 107" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 107</bibl></cit>, <cb n="MURR" /> 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:15:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 5, 15, 2</bibl>: servi mei, id. de Ira, 3, 24, 2.</sense></entryFree>
murmurator: <entryFree id="n30054" type="main" key="murmu^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murmŭrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>murmuro</etym>, <sense id="n30054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a murmurer</hi> (post-class.): summussi murmuratores, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=299" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 299</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus Deum murmuratores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Retract. 2:20" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Retract. 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judae, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
murmurillo: <entryFree id="n30055" type="main" key="murmu^rillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murmŭrillo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n30055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to murmur, mutter</hi> (ante-class.): quid murmurillas tecum? Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 143, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
murmurillum: <entryFree id="n30056" type="hapax" key="murmu^rillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murmŭrillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>murmur</etym>, <sense id="n30056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a murmuring</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
murmuriosus: <entryFree id="n30057" type="main" key="murmu^ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murmŭrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">murmuring, grumbling</hi>: murmuriosus <foreign lang="greek">goggusth/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
murmuro: <entryFree id="n30058" type="main" key="murmu^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murmŭro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1, and</itype> (ante- and post-class.) <orth extent="full" lang="la">murmŭror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to murmur, mutter; to rustle, rumble, roar</hi>, etc. (cf.: susurro, musso, fremo, strepo). </sense><sense id="n30058.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n30058.2" n="A" level="2"> Form murmuro: <cit><quote lang="la">secum murmurat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=67" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 67</bibl> Müll.—Of discontented persons, <hi rend="ital">to mutter, grumble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi murmurant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et murmuravit omnis congregatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:16:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 16, 2 al.</bibl></cit>—Of the nightingale: <cit><quote lang="la">secum ipse murmurat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magia carminibus murmurata,</quote> <trans><tr>muttered</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 304, 28</bibl></cit>.—Of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">to murmur, roar, rumble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmurantia litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=67" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 67</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">murmurans mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <trans><tr>crackles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 84, § 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intestina,</quote> <trans><tr>to rumble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30058.3" n="B" level="2"> Form murmuror: murmurari coepimus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 478</bibl>: populus murmurari coepit, Quadrig. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30058.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, transf., <hi rend="ital">to mutter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grumble at</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam tarditatem poëtae murmurari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 353 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
muro: <entryFree id="n30059" type="main" key="mu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>murus</etym>, <sense id="n30059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to provide with walls</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ca stella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi></sense></entryFree>
murocincta: <entryFree id="n30060" type="main" key="Murocincta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Murocincta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a villa of Valentinian in Lower Pannonia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 10, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
murra: <entryFree id="n30061" type="greek" key="murra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murra</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">myrrha</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">murrha</orth>, v. Bramb. Orthog. p. 107), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu/rra</foreign>. <sense id="n30061.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">the myrrh-tree, an Arabian tree, of which myrrh was the sap</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">murram in iisdem silvis permixtā arbore nasci tradidere aliqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 15, 33, § 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 310</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 399</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30061.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30061.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Myrrh</hi>, the gum which exudes from the myrrh-tree. The ancients used it to flavor their wine; <cit><quote lang="la">they also anointed their hair with a perfumed unguent made from it: lautissima apud priscos vina erant, murrae odore condita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 13, 15, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines murrā madentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines murrā madidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 555</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 393</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Med. Fac. 88</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30061.3" n="B" level="2"> Personified, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Cinyras, who was changed into a myrrh-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:298 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 298 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 58" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30062" type="main" key="murra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">murris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu/rra</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">mnrri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n30062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, called also</hi> smyrrhiza, <hi rend="ital">sweet - cicely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 16, 97, § 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30063" type="greek" key="murra3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murra</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">murrha</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">myrrha</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu/rra</foreign>. <sense id="n30063.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A stone of which costly vessels</hi> (v. murrinus and murreus) <hi rend="ital">were made</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculosae pocula murrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:80:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 80, 1</bibl></cit>; hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">vessels of murra, murrine vases</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 86</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n30063.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The myrrh-tree</hi> and <hi rend="ital">myrrh</hi>, v. myrrha. —</sense><sense id="n30063.2" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Murra</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the name of a horse</hi>, perh. of a spotted one, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 341</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
murranus: <entryFree id="n30064" type="main" key="Murra_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Murrānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Murrhan-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n30064.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a mythic king of the Latins</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 529</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30064.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Name of a slave</hi>, Inscr. Mur. 1379, 1.</sense></entryFree>
murratus: <entryFree id="n30065" type="main" key="murra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murrātus</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">myrrhā-tus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n30065.0" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Spiced</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mingled with myrrh</hi> (post-class.): potio, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=158" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 158</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 15, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30065.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Anointed with balsam of myrrh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Satiapae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
murreus: <entryFree id="n30066" type="main" key="murre^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murrĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">myrrhĕus, mur-rhĕus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. murra</etym>, <sense id="n30066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to myrrh</hi>.—Esp. </sense><sense id="n30066.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Anointed with myrrh, perfumed with myrrh</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">crinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 14, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30066.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Like myrrh, of the color of myrrh, yellowish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:10:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 10, 20</bibl> (4, 9, 22).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30067" type="main" key="murre^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murrĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">murrhĕus, myr-rhĕus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>3. murra</etym>, <sense id="n30067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the stone murra, murrean</hi>: pocula,<cb n="MUS" />  <hi rend="ital">made of murra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 5, 26: <cit><quote lang="la">poculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 119:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 119, 3</bibl></cit>.‡ † <orth extent="full" lang="la">murrhacŏpum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu/rraa)/kopon</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a medicament compounded with myrrh, for removing weariness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acopum murrhacopum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 160</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
murricidus: <entryFree id="n30068" type="main" key="murri^ci_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murrĭcīdus</orth>, v. muricidus.</entryFree>
murrinus: <entryFree id="n30069" type="main" key="murri^nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murrĭnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">murrhĭnus, myr-rhĭnus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. murra</etym>, <sense id="n30069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to myrrh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mur-rĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. potio), <hi rend="ital">a drink made of good wine, flavored with myrrh and other spices</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 51</bibl>; Doss. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 13, 15, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001::section=93" default="NO" valid="yes">§ 93</bibl>; cf.: murrina, genus potionis quae Graece dicitur <foreign lang="greek">ne/ktar</foreign>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=144" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 144</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30070" type="main" key="murri^nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murrĭnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">murrhĭnus, myr-rhĭnus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>3. murra</etym>, <sense id="n30070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the stone murra, murrine</hi> (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n30070.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trulla,</quote> <trans><tr>made of murra</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 7, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitrum,</quote> <trans><tr>painted in a manner resembling murrine vases</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 26, 67, § 198</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30070.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">murrĭna</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">myrrĭna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. vasa), <hi rend="ital">vessels of murra, murrine vases, murrines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">murrina et crystallina ex eādem terrā effodimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33</bibl></cit> prooem. § 5; 37, 2, 7, § 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:156" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 156</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
murrio: <entryFree id="n30071" type="hapax" key="murri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murrĭo</orth>, <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>mus</etym>, <sense id="n30071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to squeak like a mouse</hi>, Gloss. Isid.</sense></entryFree>
murritis: <entryFree id="n30072" type="main" key="murri_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murrītis</orth>, v. myrrhites.</entryFree>
murrobathrarius: <entryFree id="n30073" type="greek" key="murro^bathra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murrŏbathrārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">murrhob-, murob-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">mu/rra-ba/qron</foreign>, shoe</etym>, <sense id="n30073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a balsam-shoemaker, one who gives the shoes a balsamic smell</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 37</bibl> (dub.; Wagn. diabatharii; al. myrobathrarius, al. malobathrarius, al. myrobrecharius).</sense></entryFree>
mursa: <entryFree id="n30074" type="main" key="Mursa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mursa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mursĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Pannonia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Esgek</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 41" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 41</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30074.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mursen-sis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mursĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mursa</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Mursia, Mursian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mursense proelium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">episcopus (al. Mursiensis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Lucifer. 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30074.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mursīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Mursa, Mursian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caesar. 33" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caesar. 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
murta: <entryFree id="n30075" type="main" key="murta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. myrtus.</entryFree>
murtatus: <entryFree id="n30076" type="main" key="murta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murtātus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">murtĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. myrt-.</entryFree>
murtetum: <entryFree id="n30077" type="main" key="murte_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murtētum</orth>, v. myrtetum.</entryFree>
murtius: <entryFree id="n30078" type="main" key="Murti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Murtĭus</orth>, v. Murcius.</entryFree>
murtum: <entryFree id="n30079" type="main" key="murtum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">murtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. myrtum.</entryFree>
murus: <entryFree id="n30080" type="main" key="mu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūrus</orth> (archaic orthogr. moerus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:32:section=41" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 32, § 41</bibl> Müll.; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 18</bibl>, or Ann. v. 376 Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 24</bibl>: <sense id="n30080.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">moirus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 566</bibl></cit>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from root mū-; cf.: moenia, munis</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a wall;</hi> esp. <hi rend="ital">a city wall;</hi> mostly in <number>plur.</number> (class.; cf.: moenia, paries, maceria). </sense><sense id="n30080.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">muri urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:40:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 40, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Helvii intra oppida murosque compelluntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Th. 6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Th. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmoreus,</quote> <trans><tr>a balcony</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:7:48" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 7, 48</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">the wall of a building</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctae res, veluti muri et portae, quodammodo divini juris sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30080.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30080.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A bank, mound, dam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30080.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The rim</hi> or <hi rend="ital">side of a pot</hi> or <hi rend="ital">boiler</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tenui muro spatiosum colligat orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:132" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30080.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The wooden tower</hi> of an elephant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:601" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 601</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30080.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The head-dress</hi> of Cybele, ornamented with towers: crinalis, Claud. in. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 284</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30080.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a wall, a safeguard, protection, defence</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lex Aelia et Fufia, propugnacula murique tranquillitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graiūm murus Achilles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor munitum costarum et pectoris muro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 69, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic murus aëneus esto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mus: <entryFree id="n30081" type="greek" key="mu_s1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūs</orth>, <itype>mūris</itype> (<sense id="n30081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> murum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">usually murium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:157" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 157</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 27, 41, § 98</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. 1, 286 sq.), <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>kindred to Greek <foreign lang="greek">mu=s</foreign>; Sanscr. mūsh, the same, from mūsh, furari</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a mouse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum inquilini, sed etiam mures migraverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiguus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rusticus, urbanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:80 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 80 al.</bibl></cit>—Prov., v. mons, I.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim homines murium aut formicarum causā frumentum condunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 158</bibl></cit>.—Compared with parasites: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi mures semper edimus alienum cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—The ancients included under this name the rat, marten, sable, er <pb n="1179" /> <cb n="MUSC" /> mine, e. g. mures domestici, agrestes, aranei, Pontici, Libyci, marini, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 57, 82, § 221</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:71" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 19, 35, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:185" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 65, 85, § 185</bibl>: pelles, perh. <hi rend="ital">ermine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 6, 14, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odorati,</quote> <trans><tr>musk - rats</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 127, 3</bibl></cit>.—As a term of abuse, <hi rend="ital">you rat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videbo te in publicum, mus, imo terrae tuber,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 58</bibl></cit>.—As a term of endearment: <cit><quote lang="la">cum me murem dicis,</quote> <trans><tr>my little mouse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:29:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 29, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30081.1" n="II" level="1"> Mus marinus, <hi rend="ital">a kind of crustaceous sea - fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 19, 35, § 71</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 299</bibl> (Heduph. v. 2 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30082" type="main" key="Mu_s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūs</orth>, <itype>muris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. D. Decius Mus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 21, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:13:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 13, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
musa: <entryFree id="n30083" type="main" key="Mu_sa1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mou=sa</foreign>, <sense id="n30083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a muse</hi>, one of the goddesses of poetry, music, and the other liberal arts. The ancients reckoned nine of them, viz.: Clio, <hi rend="ital">the muse of history;</hi> Melpomene, <hi rend="ital">of tragedy;</hi> Thalia, <hi rend="ital">of comedy;</hi> Euterpe, <hi rend="ital">of the flute;</hi> Terpsichore, <hi rend="ital">of dancing;</hi> Calliope, <hi rend="ital">of epic poetry;</hi> Erato, <hi rend="ital">of lyric poetry;</hi> Urania, <hi rend="ital">of astronomy;</hi> Polyhymnia, <hi rend="ital">of the mimic art</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Musarum delubra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic Musarum parens domusque Pieria, Mela, 2, 3, 2: crassiore Musā,</quote> <trans><tr>in a plainer, clearer manner, without too much refinement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: sine ullā Musā, <hi rend="ital">without any genius, wit, taste</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 448, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30083.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30083.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A song, a poem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">musa procax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedestris,</quote> <trans><tr>a style of poetry bordering on prose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30083.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur., sciences, studies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est omnium, qui modo cum Musis, id est cum humanitate et cum doctrinā habeat aliquod commercium, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrestiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mansuetiores,</quote> <trans><tr>philosophical studies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30084" type="main" key="Mu_sa2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. Antonius Musa, <hi rend="ital">a physician in ordinary of Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 38, § 128</bibl>: Q. Pomponius Musa, in Eckhel. D. N. V. t. 5, p. 283.</sense></entryFree>
musaeum: <entryFree id="n30085" type="main" key="Mu_saeum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūsaeum</orth>, v. Museum.</entryFree>
musaeus: <entryFree id="n30086" type="main" key="Mu_saeus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūsaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Museus.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30087" type="main" key="Mu_saeus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūsaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mousai=os</foreign>. <sense id="n30087.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A famous Greek poet in the time of Orpheus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:15:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 15, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:667" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 667</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30087.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 701, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
musagetes: <entryFree id="n30088" type="main" key="Mu_sa^ge^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūsăgĕtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mousage/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n30088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leader of the muses</hi>, an epithet of Apollo and Hercules, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Rest. Schol. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
musca: <entryFree id="n30089" type="main" key="musca1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">musca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. makshikà, a fly; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mui=a</foreign>, of which musca, <foreign lang="greek">mui(ska</foreign>, may be a dim. form; cf. Germ. Mücke; Engl. midge, musquito</etym>, <sense id="n30089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer, abige muscas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muscas fugare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muscas captare ac stilo praeacuto configere (solebat Domitianus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of troublesome persons.—So of inquisitive, prying people, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 26</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of obtrusive, unbidden guests,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30090" type="main" key="Musca2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Musca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 40, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
muscarium: <entryFree id="n30091" type="main" key="musca_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">muscārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. muscarius, II.</entryFree>
muscarius: <entryFree id="n30092" type="main" key="musca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">muscārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>musca</etym>, <sense id="n30092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to flies, fly-</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n30092.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aranei muscarii tela,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fly-hunting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavus,</quote> <trans><tr>a broad-headed nail</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30092.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">muscā-rĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a fly-flap, fly-brush</hi>, used also as a clothes-brush, made of peacocks' tails, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:67" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 67</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> or hairy ox-tails, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 71</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> or horse-tails, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 4, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30092.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30092.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The hairy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fibrous part of plants, the umbel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semine in muscariis dependente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 26, 57, § 127</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30092.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A closet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">safe</hi>, in which writings were kept to protect them from the flies, Inscr. Rom. Viagg. a Pompeii, p. 168.</sense></entryFree>
muscellarium: <entryFree id="n30093" type="gloss" key="muscella_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">muscellārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>mus</etym>, <sense id="n30093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mousetrap</hi>: muscellarium, viverrarium, <foreign lang="greek">galea/gra</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
muscerda: <entryFree id="n30094" type="main" key="muscerda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">muscerda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mouse-dung</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 34, § 106</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=196" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 196</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
muscidus: <entryFree id="n30095" type="main" key="musci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">muscĭdus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>muscus</etym>, <sense id="n30095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of moss, mossy</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pumices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
muscipula: <entryFree id="n30096" type="main" key="musci^pu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">muscĭpŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">muscĭpŭ-lum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>mus-capio</etym>, <sense id="n30096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mouse-trap</hi>: muscipulum, <foreign lang="greek">mua/gra</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 266, 2</bibl>: qui saepe laqueos, et muscipula<cb n="MUSI" />  effugerat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 1, 8</bibl> verendum est, ne quando in muscipulā syllabas capiam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 48" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
muscipulator: <entryFree id="n30097" type="gloss" key="musci^pu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">muscĭpŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>muscipula</etym>, <sense id="n30097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mouse-catcher;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">a deceiver</hi>: muscipulator, deceptor, alterplex, Gloss. Isid.</sense></entryFree>
muscipulum: <entryFree id="n30098" type="main" key="musci^pu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">muscĭpŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. muscipula.</entryFree>
musclosus: <entryFree id="n30099" type="main" key="Musclo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Musclōsus</orth>, v. Musculosus.</entryFree>
muscose: <entryFree id="n30100" type="main" key="musco_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">muscōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. muscosus <sense id="n30100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
muscosus: <entryFree id="n30101" type="main" key="musco_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">muscōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>muscus</etym>, <sense id="n30101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of moss, mossy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 45</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil alsius, nihil muscosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">muscōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">mossily</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
muscula: <entryFree id="n30102" type="main" key="muscu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">muscŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>musca</etym>, <sense id="n30102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little fly</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">scyniphes musculae sunt brevissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 7:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
musculosus: <entryFree id="n30103" type="main" key="muscu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">muscŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>musculus</etym>. <sense id="n30103.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Muscular, fleshy</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cor naturā musculosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n30103.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Musclōsus</orth>, <itype>for Musculosus</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 337</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
musculus: <entryFree id="n30104" type="main" key="muscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">muscŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mus</etym>, <sense id="n30104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little mouse</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30104.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 7, 28, § 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30104.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30104.3" n="A" level="2"> Of other creatures. </sense><sense id="n30104.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of the whale</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 62, 88, § 186</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called musculus marinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 62, § 165</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30104.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sea-mussel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 9</bibl> (al. mytilus). —</sense><sense id="n30104.6" n="B" level="2"> Of things. </sense><sense id="n30104.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A muscle</hi> of the body: <cit><quote lang="la">quodcunque musculum laesit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">femorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:771" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 771</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">muscle, vigor</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">hanc (historiam) ossa, musculi, nervi decent,</quote> <trans><tr>vigor, force</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 8, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30104.8" n="2" level="3"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a shed, mantelet</hi> (cf.: vinea, testudo); for its form and construction, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> R. Mil. 4, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30104.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of small sailing vessel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longae naves sunt, quas dromones vocamus: dictae eo quod longiores sint ceteris: quibus contrarius musculus, curtum navigium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
muscus: <entryFree id="n30105" type="main" key="muscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">muscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n30105.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Moss</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">musco circumlita saxa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 562</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30105.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Musk</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Jov. 2</bibl>, n. 8.</sense></entryFree>
museiarius: <entryFree id="n30106" type="main" key="mu_seia_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūseiārĭus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūsaeārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, for musivarius, <sense id="n30106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a worker in mosaic</hi> (post-class.): marmorarius, musaearius, albarius, Edit. Diocl. p. 19; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 586, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
museum: <entryFree id="n30107" type="main" key="Mu_se_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūsēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūsīum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mousei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n30107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seat of the muses, a museum;</hi> a place for learned occupations, <hi rend="ital">a library, academy, study</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 20</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a grotto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 21, 42, § 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
museus: <entryFree id="n30108" type="main" key="Mu_se_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūsēus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūsaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mousei=os</foreign>, <sense id="n30108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the muses, poetical</hi> or <hi rend="ital">musical</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">musaea mele,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">musaeo lepōre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:934" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 934</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Orpheus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 124</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30108.1" n="II" level="1"> For musivus, <hi rend="ital">mosaic</hi>, Inscr. Spon. Miscell. Sect. 2.</sense></entryFree>
musia: <entryFree id="n30109" type="main" key="Mu_si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, for Mysia, like Suria for Syria, Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 8</bibl>.</entryFree>
musica: <entryFree id="n30110" type="greek" key="mu_si^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūsĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūsĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mousikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n30110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the art of music, music;</hi> acc. to the notions of the ancients, also every higher kind of <hi rend="ital">artistic</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scientific culture</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pursuit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">musicam Damone aut Aristoxeno tractante? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:33:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 33, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socci et cothurni,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>comic and dramatic poetry</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 10, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">musice antiquis temporibus tantum venerationis habuit, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
musicani: <entryFree id="n30111" type="main" key="Musica_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Musicāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people on the Indus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:8:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10" default="NO">10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:16" default="NO">16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
musicarius: <entryFree id="n30112" type="gloss" key="mu_si^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūsĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>musicus</etym>, <sense id="n30112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a musical-instrument maker</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 654, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
musicatus: <entryFree id="n30113" type="main" key="mu_si^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūsĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>musica</etym>, <sense id="n30113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">set to music</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cantilenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. p. 81, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
musice: <entryFree id="n30114" type="main" key="mu_si^ce_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūsĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. musicus <sense id="n30114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n30115" type="main" key="mu_si^ce_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūsĭcē</orth>, v. musica.</entryFree>
musicus: <entryFree id="n30116" type="greek" key="mu_si^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūsĭcus</orth>. <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mousiko/s</foreign>. <sense id="n30116.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to music, musical</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n30116.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges musicae,</quote> <trans><tr>the rules of music</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus citharae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:18:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 18, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30116.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30116.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūsĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a musician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">musicorum aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 146</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30116.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūsĭ-ca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">music</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in musicis numeri, et voces, et modi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedere se musicis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et omnia musicorum organa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:16:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 16, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30116.5" n="II" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n30116.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to poetry, poetical; subst., a poet</hi>: applicare se ad studium musicum, <hi rend="ital">the art of poetry</hi>, Ter. <cb n="MUSS" /> Heaut. prol. 23: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phorm. prol. 18</bibl></cit>: musicus pes, <hi rend="ital">a metrical foot of five syllables</hi>, ¯ <cit><quote lang="la">˘ ¯ ˘ ˘ (e. g. temperantia),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 478</bibl></cit> P.—</sense><sense id="n30116.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to science, scientific</hi>: ludus, <hi rend="ital">scientific occupation</hi>, Gell. praef.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: * <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūsĭcē</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">mousikw=s</foreign>: musice hercle agitis aetatem, <hi rend="ital">you are in clover</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">living luxuriously at another's expense</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
musigena: <entryFree id="n30117" type="main" key="Mu_si^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūsĭ-gĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Musa-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n30117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">muse-born, son of a muse</hi> (post-class.), Rufin. de Compos. et Metr. Orat.</sense></entryFree>
musimo: <entryFree id="n30118" type="greek" key="mu_si^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūsĭmo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">musmo</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mou/smwn</foreign>, <sense id="n30118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an animal of Sardinia</hi>, prob. <hi rend="ital">the muflone</hi>, from which we have the tame sheep, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 49, 75, § 199</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30118.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">musimones asini, muli, aut equi breves. Lucil. lib. sexto: pretium emit, qui vendit equum musimonem (i. e. a stallion). Cato Deletorio: asinum aut musimonem aut arietem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 137, 22 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 3, 446</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
musinor: <entryFree id="n30119" type="main" key="mu_si^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūsĭnor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. muginor <sense id="n30119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
musium: <entryFree id="n30120" type="main" key="Mu_si_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūsīum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. Museum.</entryFree>
musivarius: <entryFree id="n30121" type="main" key="mu_si_va_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūsīvārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>musivum</etym>, <sense id="n30121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a worker in mosaic</hi> (post-class.): intestinarii, statuarii, musivarii, Imp. Const. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 64, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
musivus: <entryFree id="n30122" type="greek" key="mu_si_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūsīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>musa</etym>, <sense id="n30122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a muse, artistic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontem opere musivo exornare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3323</bibl></cit>; cf. Museus.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūsīvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mousei=on</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">mosaic work, mosaic</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pictum de musivo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Pesc. 6</bibl></cit>: musivo picta genera hominum, Aug. Civ. Dei, 16, 8.</sense></entryFree>
musmo: <entryFree id="n30123" type="main" key="musmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">musmo</orth>, v. musimo.</entryFree>
musonius: <entryFree id="n30124" type="main" key="Mu_so_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūsōnĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous Stoic philosopher of the time of Tiberius, Vespasian, and Titus, teacher of Epictetus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 1, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūsōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Musonius, Musonian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mussatio: <entryFree id="n30125" type="main" key="mussa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mussātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>musso</etym>, <sense id="n30125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a suppression of the voice, silence</hi> (post-class.), v. l. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 8, 9</bibl> (al. simulatione).</sense></entryFree>
mussitabundus: <entryFree id="n30126" type="gloss" key="mussi^ta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mussĭtābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mussito</etym>, <sense id="n30126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suppressing the voice, silent</hi>, Vet. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
mussitatio: <entryFree id="n30127" type="main" key="mussi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mussĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a suppression of the voice, silence</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; Hier. in Isa. praef. 9; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:3:35" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 3, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mussitator: <entryFree id="n30128" type="main" key="mussi^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mussĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a silent person, a mutterer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:29:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 29, 24</bibl>; cf. mussitator, <foreign lang="greek">o)pogoggusth/s</foreign>, Vet. Gloss.—</sense><sense id="n30128.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A grumbler</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mussitatores discent legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:29:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 29, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mussito: <entryFree id="n30129" type="main" key="mussi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mussĭto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n30129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [musso]. </sense><sense id="n30129.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to be silent, keep quiet, not let one's self be heard; to speak in an undertone, to mutter, grumble</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">si sapis, mussitabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub lectis latentes metu mussitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita clam quidam mussitantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum David vidisset servos suos mussitantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:12:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 12, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Exod. 16, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30129.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to say in a low tone, to mutter, murmur</hi> any thing: <hi rend="ital">to be silent respecting, to take no notice of</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ego (haec) mecum mussito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 10</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malo ambigere bonos, quam ob rem id non meruerim, quam, quod est gravius, cur impetraverim, mussitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipienda et mussitanda injuria adulescentium est,</quote> <trans><tr>is to be borne in silence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 320</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
musso: <entryFree id="n30130" type="main" key="musso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">musso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n30130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (depon. collat. form: discumbimus mussati, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 249, 10</bibl>) [root mu-, shut; Sanscr. mūkas, dumb; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mua/w, muw/y</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">musth/rion</foreign>; Lat. mutus], <hi rend="ital">to say in a low tone, to mutter, murmur; to be silent respecting</hi> a thing (not in Cic. or Cæs.; syn.: mutio, murmuro). </sense><sense id="n30130.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: mussare murmurare. Ennius: in occulto mussabant. Vulgo vero pro tacere dicitur, ut idem Ennius: non decet mussare bonos, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=144" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 144</bibl> Müll. (cf. Ann. v. 185; 348; 426; <cit><quote lang="la">Trag. v. 432 Vahl.): soli Aetoli id decretum clam mussantes carpebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flent maesti mussantque patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 454</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 1, 170, 108</bibl>: aequum non est occultum id haberi, neque per metum mussari, <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brook in silence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 12</bibl>: egomet mecum mussito: Bona <pb n="1180" /> <cb n="MUTA" /> mea inhiant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid est, mussitabo potius quam inteream,</quote> <trans><tr>keep it to myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo si sapis, mussitabis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 67</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of bees, <hi rend="ital">to murmur, hum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 188</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30130.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be afraid</hi> to say or do any thing, <hi rend="ital">to be in fear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">uncertainty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mussat rex ipse Latinus, Quos generos vocet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>deliberates in silence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 657</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere mussant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvencae,</quote> <trans><tr>are silent, expect in silence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:718" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 718</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mussor: <entryFree id="n30131" type="hapax" key="mussor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mussor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, v. musso, <sense id="n30131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mustace: <entryFree id="n30132" type="main" key="musta_ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mustācē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of laurel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 127</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mustaceus: <entryFree id="n30133" type="main" key="musta_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mustācĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mustācĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n30133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a must-cake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">laurel-cake</hi>, a kind of <hi rend="ital">wedding-cake</hi> mixed with must and baked on bay-leaves: <cit><quote lang="la">mustaceos sic facito, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:200" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 200</bibl>.—Prov.: laureolam in mustaceo quaerere, <hi rend="ital">to look for a laurel-wreath in a cake</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">for fame in trifles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 20, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mustarius: <entryFree id="n30134" type="main" key="musta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mustārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mustum</etym>, <sense id="n30134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to must</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">urceus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mustax: <entryFree id="n30135" type="main" key="mustax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mustax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of laurel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 127</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mustecula: <entryFree id="n30136" type="hapax" key="muste_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mustēcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mustela</etym>, <sense id="n30136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small weasel</hi>: velox mustecula dintrit (al. velox mustelaque dintrit), Auct. Carm. Phil. 61.</sense></entryFree>
mustela: <entryFree id="n30137" type="main" key="muste_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mustēla</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mustella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mus</etym>. <sense id="n30137.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A weasel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum est mustelae posthac numquam credere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 16, § 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30137.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fish;</hi> acc. to some, <hi rend="ital">a lamprey;</hi> acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">an eelpout</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 29, § 63</bibl>: marina, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 299</bibl> (Heduph. v. 1 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
mustelatus: <entryFree id="n30138" type="hapax" key="muste_la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mustēlātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mustell-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mustela</etym>, <sense id="n30138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">weasel-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peplum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 126, 22</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
mustelinus: <entryFree id="n30139" type="main" key="muste_li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mustēlīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mustell-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a weasel, weasel-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utriculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 14, 43, § 124</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mustellago: <entryFree id="n30140" type="main" key="mustella_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mustellāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mustellago eadem ac laurago, chamaedaphne,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
