musteus: <entryFree id="n30141" type="main" key="muste^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mustĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mustum</etym>, <sense id="n30141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to new wine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">must, like must.</hi> </sense><sense id="n30141.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala, quae antea mustea vocabant, nunc melimela appellant,</quote> <trans><tr>must-apples</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30141.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">young, new, fresh</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">musteus caseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 42, 97, § 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 7, 14, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 21, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
musticus: <entryFree id="n30142" type="main" key="musti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mustĭcus</orth>, v. mysticus.</entryFree>
mustricola: <entryFree id="n30143" type="main" key="mustri^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mustrĭcŏla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mustrĭcŭla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shoemaker's last</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=147" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 147</bibl> Müll.; Afran. ib. (Com. Rel. v. 421 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
mustulentus: <entryFree id="n30144" type="main" key="mustu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mustŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mustum</etym>, <sense id="n30144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in new wine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">must</hi> (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n30144.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mustulentus auctumnus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 116, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30144.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, mustulentus aestus (or ventus), Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 63 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">415, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mustum: <entryFree id="n30145" type="main" key="mustum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mustum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. mustus, II.</entryFree>
mustuosus: <entryFree id="n30146" type="main" key="mustu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mustŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mustum</etym>, <sense id="n30146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of new wine</hi> (late Lat.), Cassiod. ap. Ps. 79, s. f.</sense></entryFree>
mustus: <entryFree id="n30147" type="main" key="mustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n30147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., young, new, fresh</hi> (as <pos>adj.</pos> only ante-class.): agna, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 711</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30147.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mustum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">new</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unfermented wine, must</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linire victuro dolia musto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:58" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 58</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, of the different kinds of must, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:125 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 125 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">musta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">vintages</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">autumns</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tercentum musta videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 146</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi de musto ac lacu fervidam orationem fugiendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:288" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 83, 288</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30147.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of oil: olei musta, <hi rend="ital">new oil</hi> (al. olei, quam musta), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 1, 2, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
musulamii: <entryFree id="n30148" type="main" key="Musula_mii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Musulāmii</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Musulāmi, Misu-lami</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a powerful African tribe, west of the Great Syrtis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 4:2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
muta: <entryFree id="n30149" type="main" key="Mu_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess, called also</hi> Lara <hi rend="ital">and</hi> Larunda, <hi rend="ital">whom Jupiter, on account of her talkativeness, struck dumb</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:583" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 583</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 35</bibl>. <cb n="MUTI" /></sense></entryFree>
mutabilis: <entryFree id="n30150" type="main" key="mu_ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>muto</etym>, <sense id="n30150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">changeable, mutable</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omne corpus mutabile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:12:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera quae vaga et mutabili erratione (al. ratione) labuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:23:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 23, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varium et mutabile semper Femina,</quote> <trans><tr>an inconstant thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 569</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus vulgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid inconstantius, aut mutabilius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:19:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 19, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: mutabilissimae deorum voluntates, Porcius Latro decl. in Catil. 16.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mū-tābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">changeably</hi> (ante-class.): mutabiliter avet, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 139, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mutabilitas: <entryFree id="n30151" type="main" key="mu_ta_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mutabilis</etym>, <sense id="n30151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">changeabieness, mutability</hi> (class.; syn.: mobilitas, inconstantia, levitas): mentis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:35:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 35, 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 871</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mutabiliter: <entryFree id="n30152" type="main" key="mu_ta_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mutabilis <sense id="n30152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mutatio: <entryFree id="n30153" type="main" key="mu_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. muto</etym>. <sense id="n30153.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A changing, altering, a change, alteration, mutation</hi> (freq. and class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vicissitudo): consilii mutatio optimus est portus paenitenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutationem facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to change</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 33, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <trans><tr>a change in the affairs of state, a revolution</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:41:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 41, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed hujus regiae prima et certissima est illa mutatio (immediately before, commutationes rerum publicarum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei mutatione amittitur ususfructus, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30153.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An exchanging, exchange</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30153.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officiorum,</quote> <trans><tr>interchange, mutual exercise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ementium,</quote> <trans><tr>traffic by exchange</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30153.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in posting, <hi rend="ital">a changing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">change of horses</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 9, 4</bibl>; cf. Cod. Th. 8, 5, 53.—</sense><sense id="n30153.4" n="C" level="2"> Rhet. term, = <foreign lang="greek">u/pallagh/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">interchange of expressions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mutator: <entryFree id="n30154" type="main" key="mu_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a changer; an exchanger, barterer</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">mutator circulus anni, i. e. Zodiacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercis mutator Eoae, i. e. mercator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:854" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 854</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum, i. e. desultor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:161" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercium commerciorumque mutator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mutatorius: <entryFree id="n30155" type="main" key="mu_ta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mutator</etym>, <sense id="n30155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to changing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exchanging</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n30155.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indumentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30155.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtātōrĭ-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n30155.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cape, tippet, wimple, change of raiment;</hi> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)nabo/laion</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Zech. 3, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n30155.4" n="B" level="2"> Mutatorium Caesaris, perh. <hi rend="ital">a house of accommodation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a pleasure-house</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Gud.</author> 199, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mutatura: <entryFree id="n30156" type="main" key="mu_ta_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. muto</etym>, <sense id="n30156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the exchange of money, paying in exchange</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:Majorian. de Curial. 4:7" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> Majorian. de Curial. 4, 7</bibl>, c. 1, § 14; 16.</sense></entryFree>
mutatus: <entryFree id="n30157" type="main" key="mu_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a change, alteration</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">incredibili mutatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mutesco: <entryFree id="n30158" type="main" key="mu_tesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtesco</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <sense id="n30158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [mutus], <hi rend="ital">to grow dumb</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia tempora, Cod. Th. 9, 40, 17: cuncta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 910</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mutgo: <entryFree id="n30159" type="main" key="Mutgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mutgo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Tyre, the father of Pygmalion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:4:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 4, 3</bibl> (in Virgil called Belus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:621" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 621</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
muthul: <entryFree id="n30160" type="hapax" key="Muthul"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Muthul</orth>, <sense id="n30160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Numidia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 48, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
muticus: <entryFree id="n30161" type="main" key="mu^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, for mutilus, <sense id="n30161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">curtailed, docked</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">spica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:48:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 48, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mutila: <entryFree id="n30162" type="hapax" key="Mu_ti^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūtĭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Istria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Medolino</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 11, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mutilago: <entryFree id="n30163" type="main" key="mu^ti^la_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭtĭlāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> tithymalus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mutilatio: <entryFree id="n30164" type="main" key="mu^ti^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭtĭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mutilo</etym>, <sense id="n30164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maiming, mutilating, mutilation</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 10, 28</bibl>; cf. mutilatio, <foreign lang="greek">a)krwthri/asis</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
mutilitas: <entryFree id="n30165" type="main" key="mu^ti^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭtĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mutilus</etym>, <sense id="n30165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperfection, defect</hi> (late Lat.), Dion. Exig. Greg. Creat. Hom. 12.</sense></entryFree>
mutilo: <entryFree id="n30166" type="main" key="mu^ti^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭtĭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>mutilus</etym>, <sense id="n30166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lop off, to cut short, clip, crop; to maim, mutilate</hi> (syn.: trunco, tondeo, amputo). </sense><sense id="n30166.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">naso auribusque mutilatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora securibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures naresque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutilatae cauda colubrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 559</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramos, id. de Nuce, 37: dentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 5, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30166.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30166.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To mutilate</hi>, in pronunciation: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30166.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To shorten, to diminish, lessen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to curtail his fortune, rob him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; exercitum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3</bibl> 12, 31: patrimonium,<cb n="MUTO" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 33, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoda urbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 42, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura libertatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 22, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mutilum: <entryFree id="n30167" type="main" key="Muti^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mutĭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n30167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in</hi> Gallia Cispadana, now <hi rend="ital">Modigliano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mutilus: <entryFree id="n30168" type="main" key="mu^ti^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭtĭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">mitulos</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">mu/tilos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n30168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">maimed, mutilated</hi> (class.; syn.: truncus, curtus, mancus). </sense><sense id="n30168.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> So of those who cut off a thumb to escape military service, Cod. Th. 7, 13, 10: <cit><quote lang="la">grabatulus uno pede mutilus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 107, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves (al. mutilatae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 12</bibl></cit>. —Of horned animals which have lost one or both horns: <cit><quote lang="la">bos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=33" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 33</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">alces mutilae sunt cornibus,</quote> <trans><tr>without horns</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence jestingly, transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic mutilus (i. e. exsecto cornu) minitaris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30168.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutila et quasi decurtata (in oratione) sentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:53:178" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 53, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutila quaedam et hiantia loqui,</quote> <trans><tr>too briefly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mutina: <entryFree id="n30169" type="main" key="Mu^ti^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŭtĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Cisalpine Gaul</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Modena</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 9, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:20" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 20</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŭtĭnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mutina</hi>: proelium, <hi rend="ital">near Mutina, between Antony and Octavius</hi>, 711 A. U. C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:627" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 627</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mutini: <entryFree id="n30170" type="main" key="Muti_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mutīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the city of Mute, in Sicily, Mutines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Pis. p. 13" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Pis. p. 13</bibl> Orell.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 40, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mutinus: <entryFree id="n30171" type="main" key="Mu_ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūtīnus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūtūnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. muto</etym>, <sense id="n30171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an appellation of</hi> Priapus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 11.—</sense><sense id="n30171.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, = penis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mutio: <entryFree id="n30172" type="main" key="mu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">muttĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>from the sound mu</etym>, <sense id="n30172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to mutter, mumble, speak in a low tone</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; syn.: murmuro, musso). </sense><sense id="n30172.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: etiam muttis? <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Jam tacebo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 225</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inpinge pugnum, si muttiverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil jam mutire audeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque opus est Adeo mutito,</quote> <trans><tr>nor should it even be muttered, be hinted at</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si muttivero, etiam quod certo scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 84</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30172.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30172.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bleat</hi>, as a he-goat, Auct. Carm. Philom. 58; <hi rend="ital">to bark</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mutiet canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 11, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30172.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To creak</hi>, of a hinge: <cit><quote lang="la">num muttit cardo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30172.5" n="C" level="2"> Mutire, loqui. Ennius in Telepho: palam mutire plebeio piaculum est, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=145" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 145</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 376 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
mutitas: <entryFree id="n30173" type="gloss" key="mu_ti^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mutus</etym>, <sense id="n30173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dumbness</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">a)fwni/a</foreign>, mutitas, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
mutitatio: <entryFree id="n30174" type="gloss" key="mu_ti^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mutito</etym>, <sense id="n30174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mutual inviting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">invitation</hi>: NOBILIVM MVTITATIONES CENARVM, Verr. Fl. ap. Kalend. Praenest. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2, p. 388 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
mutitio: <entryFree id="n30175" type="main" key="mu_ti_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtītĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">muttītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mutio</etym>, <sense id="n30175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a muttering, mumbling</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid tibi hanc curatio'st rem, verbero, aut mutitio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mutito: <entryFree id="n30176" type="main" key="mu_ti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtĭto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>1. muto</etym>, <sense id="n30176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to interchange, to appoint by turns;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to invite by turns, give mutual invitations</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">principes civitatis, qui ludis Megalensibus antiquo ritu mutitarent, id est, mutua inter se convivia agitarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:2:11" default="NO">18, 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mutitus: <entryFree id="n30177" type="main" key="mu_ti_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. mutio.</entryFree>
mutius: <entryFree id="n30178" type="main" key="Mu^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŭtĭus</orth>, v. Mucius.</entryFree>
muto: <entryFree id="n30179" type="main" key="mu_to1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (arch. <sense id="n30179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> mutassis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 49</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> mutarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. prol. 74</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <hi rend="ital">freq.</hi> [moveo]. </sense><sense id="n30179.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to move, to move away</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from its place, to move to a place</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">neque se luna quoquam mutat,</quote> <trans><tr>does not move, does not budge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 117</bibl></cit>: illa tamen se Non habitu mutatve loco, <hi rend="ital">does not quit her dress</hi> or <hi rend="ital">her dwelling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis invitus civitate mutetur,</quote> <trans><tr>be forced to leave, be driven from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc dum muter,</quote> <trans><tr>if I can only get away from here</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:73" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 73</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30179.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30179.3" n="A" level="2"> Of change in the thing spoken of itself. </sense><sense id="n30179.4" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n30179.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to alter, change</hi> a thing (freq. and class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vario): sententiam mutare numquam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Mur 29, 61</bibl></cit>: ego rogatus mutavi consilium meum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudinem dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:314" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 91, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes vestras voluntatesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum testamentum mutare cuperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: propositum. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne haec mutet fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: nequeo exorare <pb n="1181" /> <cb n="MUTO" /> ut me maneat et cum illo ut mutet fidem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas,</quote> <trans><tr>to alter one's will</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:55" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 55</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura nescia mutari,</quote> <trans><tr>incapable of change</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:240" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 240</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">ob</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutatum jus ob unius feneratoris libidinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilem mutatu gentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 23</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gubernatori ad incursus tempestatum ... ratio mutanda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad singulas paene distinctiones vultus mutandus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 47</bibl></cit>.—With Gr. <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutata suos flumina cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negat quicquam ex Latinā ratione mutandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 89</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illo fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 28</bibl></cit> supra; more freq. cum aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to change with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">under the influence of a thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies locorum cum ventis simul mutatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 78:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 78, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum fortunā non animum mutāsset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:82:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 82, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum uvarum vini jucunditas cum regione mutatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Abrah. 2, 10, 68</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona facile mutantur in pejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi forte non ex Graeco mutantes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex feminis mutari in mares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 4, 3, § 36</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de uxore nihil mutat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 46</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum mutatus ab illo Hectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe mutatus ab illo Sampsone, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Spir. Sanc. 2</bibl></cit>, prol. § 13.—Non mutat, with <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause, it makes no difference</hi>: nec mutat confestim, an interjecto tempore, fidem suam adstrinxerunt, Pap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:1:52:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 1, 52, § 2</bibl>. —With <hi rend="ital">abl. instrum</hi>. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ut silvae foliis pronos mutantur in annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30179.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, = mutari, <hi rend="ital">to alter, change</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum mores mutaverint argumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:51:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 51, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam mutabat aestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">annona ex ante convectā copiā nihil mutavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox in superbiam mutans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo animi mutaverant, ut clariorem inter Romanos deditio Postumium ... faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum mutāsse fortunam, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:51:10" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 51, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30179.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To differ, be different</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastiones hiberno ac verno tempore hoc mutant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum mutare a Menandro Caecilius visus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30179.8" n="(g)" level="5"> Of style, <hi rend="ital">to vary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an ego ... poetis, et maxime tragicis concederem, ut ne omnibus locis eādem contentione uterentur, crebroque mutarent? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:31:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 31, 109</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30179.9" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n30179.10" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To change the color of, to color, dye</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inficio, imbuo): aries jam suave rubenti Murice, jam croceo mutabit vellera luto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec lanarum colores, quibus simplex ille candor mutatus est, elui possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30179.11" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To change for the better, make better, to improve</hi>: placet tibi factum, Micio? <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non, si queam mutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30179.12" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To change for the worse; pass.</hi>, of wine, <hi rend="ital">to spoil, turn</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ac, nisi mutatum, parcit defundere vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melle mutatum (sc. balsamum),</quote> <trans><tr>adulterated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30179.13" n="B" level="2"> Of change in its relation to other things, etc. </sense><sense id="n30179.14" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to change</hi> one thing, etc., for another: <cit><quote lang="la">mutatis ad celeritatem jumentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta mutanti tunica ardere visa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calceos et vestimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 28</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq.: mutare vestem, <hi rend="ital">to change one's dress: An.</hi> Muta vestem. <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Ubi mutem? ... <hi rend="ital">An.</hi> Eamus ad me. Ibi proximum'st ubi mutes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 61</bibl> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">mutando nunc vestem, nunc tegumenta capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18, 2</bibl>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">to put on the garb of mourning, of humility</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro me praesente senatus hominumque praeterea viginti millia vestem mutaverunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> post Red. ad Quir. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo ut vestem mutaret, aut supplex prensaret homines, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 37, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 23</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n30179.15" n="2" level="3"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n30179.16" n="a" level="4"> Mutata verba, i. e. <hi rend="ital">figurative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutata (verba), in quibus pro verbo proprio subicitur aliud, quod idem significet, sumptum ex re aliquā consequenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 27, 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30179.17" n="b" level="4"> Of style, <hi rend="ital">to vary, alter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum est ut dicas de conversā oratione atque mutatā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus eloquendi ... mutatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30179.18" n="c" level="4"> Of one's assertion or promise: <cit><quote lang="la">quod dixi semel, hau mutabo,</quote> <trans><tr>will not break my word</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30179.19" n="d" level="4"> Of place, <hi rend="ital">to change, shift, alter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum ex loco mutans (sc. typhon) rapidā vertigine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 48, 49, § 132</bibl></cit>; cf.: quod nec injussu populi<cb n="MUTU" />  mutari finibus posset, <hi rend="ital">to be removed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 46, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsules sunt, etiam si solum non mutārunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>gone into exile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussa pars mutare Lares et urbem Sospite cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:Sec. 39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. Sec. 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30179.20" n="C" level="2"> Of common or reciprocal relations, <hi rend="ital">to interchange, exchange</hi>.—With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum amplificatione vectigalium nomen Hieronicae legis mutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:8:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 8, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vestem cum illo mutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cujus suorum popularium mutatam secum fortunam esse vellent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:45:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 45, 6</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Hostilio pro Etruriā Tarentum mutaverant (sonatus) provinciam, pro Tarento Capuam mutaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:35:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 35, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non debere eum incerta pro certis mutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 83:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 83, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutatos pro Macedonibus Romanos dominos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:49:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 49, 6</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">abl. of that for which the exchange</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">is made</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid terras alio calentes Sole mutamus (patriā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriae possessionem incertā pace mutāsse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; also with <hi rend="ital">abl. of that given in exchange</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">victrice patriā victam mutari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 30, 3</bibl></cit>.—So esp. of trading, etc., <hi rend="ital">to exchange, barter, sell</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">coepit captivos conmercari Aleos, si quem reperire possit, qui mutet suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homines captivos conmercatur, si queat Aliquem invenire, suum qui mutet filium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 2, 68: hic mutat merces surgente a sole, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutandi copia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvam Furtivā mutat strigili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suburbanis lactens porcus aere mutandus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caetera reponantur, vel aere mutentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aere mutandi sunt (sc. apri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis Milesia magno Vellera mutentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 307</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <hi rend="ital">pers. with whom the exchange is made</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eaque mutare cum mercatoribus vino advecticio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 44, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutare res inter se instituerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30179.21" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To forsake, abandon, leave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutare, derelinquere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 351, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expertum jam principem anxii mutabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 44</bibl></cit>: mihi non persuadetur ... mutem meos, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 351, 3</bibl>: mutataque sidera pondus Quaesivere suum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">forsaken</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abandoned by the gods</hi>, Petr. poët. 124, 264.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., changed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">different, successive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (facies) mutatis inducitur atque fovetur Tot medicaminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:472" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 472</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30180" type="main" key="mu_to2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūto</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = membrum virile (rare and only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>), Lucil. ap. Porphyr. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 68</bibl>; also <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> Orell. (K. and H. muttonis).</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30181" type="main" key="Mu_to3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūto</orth>, <sense id="n30181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, Cic. Fragm. Or. pro Fundan. p. 445 Orell.</sense></entryFree>
mutoniatus: <entryFree id="n30182" type="main" key="mu_to_ni^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtōnĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. muto</etym>: magno pene praeditus (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:73:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 73, 1</bibl>.</entryFree>
mutonium: <entryFree id="n30183" type="main" key="mu_to_nium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtōnium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, i. q. 2. muto, Vet. Lex. Gr. Lat.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:Fr. Inc. 190" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> Fr. Inc. 190</bibl>: mutonium, <foreign lang="greek">pe/os</foreign>.</entryFree>
muttio: <entryFree id="n30184" type="main" key="mutti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">muttĭo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">muttītĭo</orth>, etc., v. mutio, etc.</entryFree>
muttum: <entryFree id="n30185" type="gloss" key="muttum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">muttum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n30185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mutter, a grunt</hi>: muttum, <foreign lang="greek">gru=</foreign>, Gloss. Vet.: non audet dicere muttum, Lucil.: proverbialiter dicimus, muttum nullum emiseris, id est, verbum, Cornutus ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:119" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 119</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mutuarius: <entryFree id="n30186" type="main" key="mu_tu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mutuus</etym>, <sense id="n30186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mutual</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">operae,</quote> <trans><tr>exchanges of services</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 284, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mutuaticius: <entryFree id="n30187" type="main" key="mu_tu^a_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtŭātīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mutuor</etym>, <sense id="n30187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">borrowed</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in pecuniae mutuaticiae usu (al. mutuaticae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:41" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mutuatio: <entryFree id="n30188" type="main" key="mu_tu^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtŭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a borrowing</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum multos minutis mutuationibus defraudāsset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">translationes quasi mutuationes sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 156</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mutuatus: <entryFree id="n30189" type="main" key="mu_tu^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtŭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> <sense id="n30189.0" n="I" level="1"> Of 2. mutuo.—</sense><sense id="n30189.1" n="II" level="1"> Of mutuor; v. h. vv.</sense></entryFree>
mutucumenses: <entryFree id="n30190" type="hapax" key="Mutucumenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mutucumenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of a city in Latium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 69</bibl> (rejected by Jahn).</sense></entryFree>
mutue: <entryFree id="n30191" type="main" key="mu_tu^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtŭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mutuus <sense id="n30191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
mutuiter: <entryFree id="n30192" type="main" key="mu_tu^i^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtŭĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mutuus <sense id="n30192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> C.</sense></entryFree>
mutuito: <entryFree id="n30193" type="main" key="mu_tu^i^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtŭĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtŭĭtor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>mutuo or mutuor</etym>, <sense id="n30193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to seek to borrow</hi> from a person: <cit><quote lang="la">mutuitanti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Mere. prol. 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mutulus: <entryFree id="n30194" type="main" key="mu_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n30194.0" n="I" level="1"> In architecture, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="MUTU" /> <hi rend="ital">mutule, modillion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30194.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fish;</hi> v. mitulus.</sense></entryFree>
mutuo: <entryFree id="n30195" type="main" key="mu_tu^o_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtŭō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mutuus <sense id="n30195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30196" type="main" key="mu_tu^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtŭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. mutuor <sense id="n30196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 1.</sense></entryFree>
mutuor: <entryFree id="n30197" type="main" key="mu_tu^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtŭor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n30197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [mutuus], <hi rend="ital">to borrow</hi> something of some one (class.; opp. mutuum do, commodo, credo). </sense><sense id="n30197.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to obtain a loan of money</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutuari pecunias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:73" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 73</bibl></cit>.—Also without <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Caelio mutuabimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutuari cogor,</quote> <trans><tr>I am obliged to borrow</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 15, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of other things than money: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia ad bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:21" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30197.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to borrow, to take for one's use, to derive, obtain, get, procure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator subtilitatem ab Academiā mutuatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a viris virtus nomen est mutuata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:18:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 18, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium ab amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (sensum) a Latrone mutuatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:10:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figuras ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit> prooem. 25: <cit><quote lang="la">verba ex proximo mutuari licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a personis affectus mutuari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 73</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 12, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:27" default="NO">12, 10, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium ab innocentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regem a finitimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:ib. 3:4:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 178, 11</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n30197.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtŭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <hi rend="ital">to borrow</hi>: ad amicum currat mutuatum: mutuet mea causa, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 474, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30197.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtŭ-ātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">luna mutu atā a sole luce fulget,</quote> <trans><tr>with borrowed light</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mutus: <entryFree id="n30198" type="main" key="mu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root mu-, to shut; Sanscr. mūkas, dumb; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mu/tis, mua/w</foreign>; cf. Lat. mussare</etym>, <sense id="n30198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dumb, mute</hi> (class.; cf.: infans, elinguis). </sense><sense id="n30198.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that does not speak, silent</hi>.—Of creatures who do not possess the faculty of speech, and can utter only inarticulate sounds: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:8:section=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 8, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:334" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:56" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satius est mutum esse quam quod nemo intellegat dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subjugale, animal,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Pet. 2, 16: <cit><quote lang="la">vere dici potest, magistratum legem esse loquentem, legem autem mutum magistratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: papae! Jugularas hominem: quid ille? <hi rend="ital">Thr.</hi> Mutus illico, <hi rend="ital">he was struck speechless, was silent, could not say a word more</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mandata mancus est, caecus, mutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 45</bibl></cit>: mutum dices, <hi rend="ital">you shall call me dumb</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I will not say a word</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis pro nobis gratia muta fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>has not spoken a word</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:52" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutus aspectus miserorum lacrimas movet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam vox est de te mea muta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I have never ceased to praise thee</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:14:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 14, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolore lyra est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <trans><tr>which makes one mute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 9, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 24</bibl>.—Of that which utters no sound, <hi rend="ital">dumb, mute, silent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tintinnabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <trans><tr>the silent sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consonantes,</quote> <trans><tr>which cannot be pronounced alone, mutes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: artes, <hi rend="ital">the plastic arts, arts of design</hi>, opp. to eloquence, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 7</bibl>; also, artes, <hi rend="ital">the silent arts</hi>, i. e. which do not concern themselves with language, as medicine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 397</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>which does not impart the power of speaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:119" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumentum fundi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>wagons, carts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>books</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <trans><tr>that say nothing, have no inscriptions on them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:de Lim. p. 156" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> de Lim. p. 156</bibl></cit> Goes.: muta exta dicuntur, quibus nihil divinationis aut deorum responsi inesse animadvertunt, contra adjutoria, quae certum aliquid eventurum indicant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=157" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 157</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra muta,</quote> <trans><tr>dumb idols</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 12, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30198.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of places where no sound is heard, <hi rend="ital">silent, still</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutum forum, elinguem curiam, tacitam et fractam civitatem videbatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> post Red. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spelunca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:239" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 239</bibl></cit>.—Of times: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum fuit tempus, quod magis debuerit mutum esse a litteris,</quote> <trans><tr>in which nothing should have been written</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentia noctis,</quote> <trans><tr>the deep silence of night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 184</bibl></cit>.—Of things of which nothing is said: <cit><quote lang="la">mutum aevum,</quote> <trans><tr>not celebrated, unsung</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:579" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 579</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30198.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dumb person, a mute</hi> (ante- and postclass): <hi rend="ital">Char.</hi> Quin taces? <hi rend="ital">Eut.</hi> Muto imperas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 26</bibl>: sicut mutus, Vulg. <pb n="1182" /> <cb n="MYAC" /> Psa. 38, 13: <cit><quote lang="la">aperta erit lingua mutorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Isa. 35, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 15, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutum neque stipulari neque promittere posse palam est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:105" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30198.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. animal), <hi rend="ital">a dumb creature, brute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">separat hoc nos A grege mutorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:143" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 143</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mutusca: <entryFree id="n30199" type="main" key="Mu^tusca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŭtusca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = Trebula Mutusca, <sense id="n30199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in the Sabine territory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivifera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 711</bibl></cit>. Its inhabitants are called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trēbŭlāni Metusci</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 107</bibl>; v. Trebula.</sense></entryFree>
mutuus: <entryFree id="n30200" type="main" key="mu_tu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. muto</etym>, <sense id="n30200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">borrowed, lent</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n30200.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullus est tibi, quem roges mutuom Argentum,</quote> <trans><tr>to lend you money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutuum talentum dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to lend, advance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutuum argentum quaerere,</quote> <trans><tr>to seek to borrow money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic drachmarum argenti haec mille dederat mutuom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam si mutuas (sc. minas) non potero, certumst sumam faenore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 95</bibl></cit>: mutuas pecunias sumere ab aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to borrow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">raise money of any one</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 11, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutuum frumentum dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to lend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 30, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quoi mutuom quid dederis, fit pro proprio perditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 44</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30200.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtŭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a loan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutui datio,</quote> <trans><tr>a lending</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:90" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:1:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 1, 2</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: mutuo, <hi rend="ital">by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon a loan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut sumtum aliunde, ut mutuo, aut factum ab ipso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:24:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 24, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere mutuo naves, pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutuo sumamus pecunias in tributa regis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Esdr. 5, 4; cf. <pos>adv.</pos> mutuo, infra; and Krebs, Antibarb. p. 731.—</sense><sense id="n30200.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si pudoris egeas, sumas mutuum,</quote> <trans><tr>borrow shame, if you have none</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 187</bibl></cit>: ego cum illā facere nolo mutuum: <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Quid ita? <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Quia proprium facio; <cit><quote lang="la">amo pariter semul,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I do not want to borrow her love, but to possess it as my own</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30200.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">in return, in exchange, reciprocal, mutual</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">olores mutuā carne vescuntur inter se,</quote> <trans><tr>eat one another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 32, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:755" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 755</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <trans><tr>wounds inflicted by each on the other</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:65:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 65, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aemulatio virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox omnia erroris mutui implevit,</quote> <trans><tr>on both sides</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutuum facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to do the same, return like for like</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 37</bibl></cit>: ut amore perdita est haec misera! <hi rend="ital">Pyr.</hi> Mutuum fit (sc. a me), <hi rend="ital">I do the same, return like for like</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 38</bibl>: per mutua, <hi rend="ital">mutually, on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from one another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus per mutua nexis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 66</bibl></cit>. So, mutua: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se mortales mutua vivunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e laevo sit mutua dexter,</quote> <trans><tr>again, on the other hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 325</bibl></cit> (302): <cit><quote lang="la">mutuus ut nos Affectus petere auxilium juberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:149" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 149</bibl></cit>: —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in three forms. </sense><sense id="n30200.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mū-tŭō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in return, by turns, reciprocally, mutually</hi> (class.; cf.: invicem, vicissim): studia officii mutuo inter nos certatim constiterunt, Lepid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 34, 3</bibl>: me mutuo diligas, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 15, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercere officia cum multis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 53</bibl></cit>: cum de se mutuo sentire provinciam crederet, <hi rend="ital">that it was disposed towards him as he was towards it</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 48.—</sense><sense id="n30200.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtŭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">mutually, in return</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 7, 2</bibl></cit> (al. mutuo): <cit><quote lang="la">respondisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit> (al. mutuo).—</sense><sense id="n30200.7" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūtŭĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">mutually, in return</hi> (anteclass.): vive, meque ama mutuiter, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 513, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mutyca: <entryFree id="n30201" type="main" key="Mu^ty^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŭtyca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŭtycē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*motu/ka</foreign>, <sense id="n30201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Sicily, between Camarina and Syracuse</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Modica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:268" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 268</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŭtycensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mutyce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:43:section=101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 43, § 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 51, § 120</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŭty-censes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Mutyca</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mya: <entryFree id="n30202" type="greek" key="my^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mya</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu/a</foreign>, <sense id="n30202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of mussel</hi> on the shores of the Thracian Bosporus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 56, § 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
