myacanthos: <entryFree id="n30203" type="greek" key="my^a^canthos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myăcanthos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">myăcan-thon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o( mua/kanqos, to\ mua/kanqon</foreign>, <sense id="n30203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> corruda, <hi rend="ital">and, by the Greeks</hi>, hormenos or myacanthos, <hi rend="ital">the wild asparagus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 42, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myaces: <entryFree id="n30204" type="greek" key="my^a^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myăces</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu/akes</foreign>, <sense id="n30204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sea-mussels</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 9, 31, § 95</bibl>. <cb n="MYIA" /></sense></entryFree>
myagros: <entryFree id="n30205" type="greek" key="my^a^gros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myăgros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu/agros</foreign>, <sense id="n30205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 81, § 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myax: <entryFree id="n30206" type="main" key="my^ax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu/ac</foreign>, <sense id="n30206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of mussel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 9, 30, § 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mycale: <entryFree id="n30207" type="main" key="My^ca^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mycălē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*muka/lh</foreign>. <sense id="n30207.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A promontory and city in Ionia, opposite the Isle of Samos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 223</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 14, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30207.1" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n30207.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mycălaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mycale, Mycalean</hi>: litora, Claud. in. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 264</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30207.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mycă-lensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mycale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30207.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A female poisoner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 263</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 525" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 525</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mycalessos: <entryFree id="n30208" type="main" key="My^ca^lessos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mycălessos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Mycălēsos</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mukalhsso/s</foreign>, <sense id="n30208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain and city in Bœotia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:272" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 272</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 25</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n30208.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mycălēsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Mycalesian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuspis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:281" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 281</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mycematias: <entryFree id="n30209" type="greek" key="my^ce_ma^ti^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mycēmătĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mukhmati/as</foreign>, <sense id="n30209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an earthquake accompanied by a rumbling noise</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 7, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mycenae: <entryFree id="n30210" type="main" key="My^ce_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mycēnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mycēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mycēne</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mukhnai, *mukh/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n30210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated city in Argolis, of which Agamemnon was king</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agamemnoniaeque Mycenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:838" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 838</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 414</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 426 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deprensus urbe Mycenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diti sacrata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante Agamemnoniam ... Mycenen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:27" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 27</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30210.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n30210.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mycēnaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mycenæ, Mycenæan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ductor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Agamemnon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teque, Mycenaeo, Phoebas, amata duci,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cassandra, beloved by Agamemnon, king of Mycenæ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:400" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus, i. e. Agamemnonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rates,</quote> <trans><tr>the Grecian fleet, under the command of Agamemnon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:15:32" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 15, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30210.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mycēnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mycenæ, Mycenæan</hi>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mycēnenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Mycenæ, the Mycenæans</hi>, Cic. poët. Fin. 2, 6, 18.—</sense><sense id="n30210.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mycēnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Mycenæan</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Iphigenia, daughter of Agamemnon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppositā fertur mutāsse Mycenida cervā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mycenica: <entryFree id="n30211" type="hapax" key="Myceni^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mycenĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place near Argos, in the Peloponnesus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mycenis: <entryFree id="n30212" type="main" key="My^ce_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mycēnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Mycenae, II. C.</entryFree>
mycetias: <entryFree id="n30213" type="greek" key="my_ce_ti^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mȳcētĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mukhti/as</foreign>, for mycematias, <sense id="n30213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an earthquake attended with a rumbling noise</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Mund. p. 65, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mycon: <entryFree id="n30214" type="main" key="My^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mycon</orth>, v. Micon.</entryFree>
myconos: <entryFree id="n30215" type="main" key="My^co^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mycŏnos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mu/konos</foreign>, <sense id="n30215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Cyctades</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Mykoni</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 463</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30215.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mycŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Myconos, Myconian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 7, 9, § 75</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mycŏnĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Myconos, the Myconians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 47, § 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mydriasis: <entryFree id="n30216" type="greek" key="mydri^a^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mydrĭăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mudri/asis</foreign>, a disease of the eyes, <sense id="n30216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a preternatural dilatation of the pupil, mydriasis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mygale: <entryFree id="n30217" type="main" key="my^ga^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mygălē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mugalh=</foreign> (post-class.), <sense id="n30217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small species of mouse</hi>, called in pure Lat. mus araneus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mygdones: <entryFree id="n30218" type="main" key="Mygdo^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mygdŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mugdo/nes</foreign>, <sense id="n30218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Thrace, who afterwards took possession of a part of Phrygia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:126" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 30, 33, § 126</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30218.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n30218.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mygdŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mugdoni/a</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n30218.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A district in Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 38</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n30218.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A district in Phrygia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 41, § 145</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 40, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30218.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A district in Mesopotamia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 16, § 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30218.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A district in Bithynia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 42, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30218.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mygdŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Mygdon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 342</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30218.8" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mygdŏnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Mygdonian, Phrygian, Lydian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mygdonidesque nurus, i. e. Lydiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 45</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30218.9" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mygdŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n30218.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Mygdonian, Phrygian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor, i. e. Phrygium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater,</quote> <trans><tr>the mother of the gods, Cybele</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:47" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <trans><tr>Tithonus, the husband of Aurora, and son of the Phrygian king Laomedon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:108" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 108</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n30218.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Melas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 247</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
myiagros: <entryFree id="n30219" type="main" key="My^i^a^gros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Myĭăgros</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mui/agros</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*mui=(agros</foreign>, <sense id="n30219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fly-catcher</hi>, a deity, by invoking whom flies were destroyed; <cit><quote lang="la">called also Myodes or Myiodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 28, 40, § 75</bibl></cit>. <cb n="MYRI" /></sense></entryFree>
myiodes: <entryFree id="n30220" type="main" key="My^io_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Myiōdes</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">muiw/dhs</foreign>, i. q. Myiagros, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 34, § 106</bibl>.</entryFree>
myiscae: <entryFree id="n30221" type="greek" key="my^iscae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myiscae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mui(skai</foreign>, <sense id="n30221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">small sca-mussels</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 9, 31, § 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:149" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myiscus: <entryFree id="n30222" type="main" key="my^iscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myiscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small sea-mussel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mylae: <entryFree id="n30223" type="main" key="My_lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mȳlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mȳlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:202" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 202</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mu/lai</foreign>. <sense id="n30223.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Sicily</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Milazzo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:79:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 79, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 16</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mȳlaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mylæ, Mylæan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut Pompeiani Mylaea pericula belli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mosell. 215</bibl></cit> (al. Milasena).—</sense><sense id="n30223.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Thessaly</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Dhamasi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30223.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Two islands near Crete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mylas: <entryFree id="n30224" type="main" key="Mylas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mylas</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Myla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Sicily</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Marcellino</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mylasa: <entryFree id="n30225" type="main" key="My_la^sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mȳlăsa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mylassa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mu/lasa, *mu/lassa</foreign>, <sense id="n30225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Caria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Melassa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 108</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30225.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mȳlăsensis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Mylass-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mylasa, Mylasian</hi>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mȳlăsenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Mylasa, the Mylasians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 25, 11</bibl> and 13.—</sense><sense id="n30225.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mȳlăsēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mylasa, Mylasian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 215</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mȳlăsēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Mylasa, the Mylasians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:39:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 39, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30225.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mȳlăsĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mylasa, Mylasian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cannabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 9, 56, § 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecdici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:56:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 56, 1</bibl></cit> (B. and K. Mylasii). —</sense><sense id="n30225.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mylăseus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mulaseu/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Mylasa; plur</hi>. Mylasis = <foreign lang="greek">*mulasei=s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:56:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 56, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mylasia: <entryFree id="n30226" type="main" key="mylasi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mylasĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of hemp</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 9, 56, § 174</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myloecus: <entryFree id="n30227" type="greek" key="my^loecus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myloecus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu/loikos</foreign>, <sense id="n30227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of moth</hi>, which breeds in mills, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 141</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myndus: <entryFree id="n30228" type="main" key="Myndus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Myndus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mu/ndos</foreign>, <sense id="n30228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Caria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Gumishlu Liman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:34:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 34, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:16:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 16, 3</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Myndii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Myndus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 20, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myobarbum: <entryFree id="n30229" type="main" key="myo^barbum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myŏbarbum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vox hibr., from <foreign lang="greek">mu=s</foreign>-barba</etym> (mouse-beard), <sense id="n30229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rather long drinking-vessel terminating in a point</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> 2, 27</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
myoctonos: <entryFree id="n30230" type="greek" key="myocto^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myoctŏnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">muokto/nos</foreign> (mouse-killer), <sense id="n30230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of</hi> aconitum, <hi rend="ital">said to kill mice by its smell</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 3, 2, § 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myonnesus: <entryFree id="n30231" type="main" key="Myonne_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Myonnēsus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*muo/nnhsos</foreign>. <sense id="n30231.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Masc., a promontory in Ionia, with a city of the same name</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ovreokastro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27" default="NO" valid="yes">27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30231.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fem., an island near Ephesus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 38, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myoparo: <entryFree id="n30232" type="greek" key="myo^pa^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myŏpăro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">muopa/rwn</foreign>, <sense id="n30232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of light piratical vessel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:80:section=186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 80, § 186</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 34, § 87</bibl>; Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 534, 16</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=147" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 147</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
myophonos: <entryFree id="n30233" type="greek" key="my^o^pho^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myŏphŏnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">muofo/nos</foreign> (mouse-killer), <sense id="n30233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, perh. i. q. myoctonos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 9, 30, § 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myops: <entryFree id="n30234" type="greek" key="my^ops"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myops</orth>, <itype>ōpis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">muw/y</foreign>, <sense id="n30234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">near-sighted</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:10:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 10, § 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myosota: <entryFree id="n30235" type="greek" key="my^o^so_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myŏsōta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">myŏsōtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">muosw/th, muoswti/s</foreign>, <sense id="n30235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mouse-ear, a plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 80, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myosoton: <entryFree id="n30236" type="greek" key="my^o^so_ton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myŏsōton</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">muo/swton</foreign>, <sense id="n30236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant</hi> alsine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 4, 8, § 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myotacismus: <entryFree id="n30237" type="main" key="myotacismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myotacismus</orth>, v. l. for <orth extent="full" lang="la">moetacis-mus</orth>, <sense id="n30237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the frequent repetition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">recurrence of the letter m</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 448</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 514</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Inst. Div. Litt. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrapia: <entryFree id="n30238" type="greek" key="myra^pi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrăpĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">myrrhăpĭa</orth>) <itype>pira</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">mura/pia</foreign>, <sense id="n30238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sweet-smelling pear</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:19:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 19, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 10, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrice: <entryFree id="n30239" type="greek" key="my^ri_ce_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrīcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">myrīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">muri/kh</foreign>, <sense id="n30239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the tamarisk, a kind of shrub</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 21, 37, § 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 9, 41, § 67</bibl>.—Prov., to signify something impossible: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguia corticibus sudent electra myricae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30240" type="main" key="My^ri_ce_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Myrīcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nymph, from whom Hannibal's wife Imilce was said to be descended</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:103" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrina: <entryFree id="n30241" type="main" key="Myri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Myrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*muri/na</foreign>. <sense id="n30241.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fortified seaport town of the Æolians, in Asia Minor</hi>, afterwards called <hi rend="ital">Sebastopolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 30, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n30241.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Myrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <pb n="1183" /> <cb n="MYRS" /> <hi rend="ital">belonging to Myrina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:43:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 43, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30241.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in the Isle of Lemnos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 73</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n30241.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Crete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myriogenesis: <entryFree id="n30242" type="greek" key="my_ri^o^ge^ne^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mȳrĭŏgĕnĕsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">murioge)nesis</foreign>, <sense id="n30242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">multiple generation</hi>, Firm. Math. 8, 18.</sense></entryFree>
myrionymus: <entryFree id="n30243" type="greek" key="my_ri^o_ny^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mȳrĭōnymus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">muriw/numos</foreign>, <sense id="n30243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with countless names</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 8, 3, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myriophyllon: <entryFree id="n30244" type="greek" key="my_ri^o^phyllon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mȳrĭŏ-phyllon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">murio/fullon</foreign>, pure Lat. millefolium, <sense id="n30244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant milfoil, yarrow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 16, 95, § 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myriza: <entryFree id="n30245" type="main" key="My^riza"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Myriza</orth>, v. Myrriza.</entryFree>
myrmeces: <entryFree id="n30246" type="main" key="Myrme_ce^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Myrmēcĕs Scŏpŭli</orth>, <sense id="n30246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rocks in the sea, near Smyrna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 119</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrmecias: <entryFree id="n30247" type="greek" key="myrme_ci^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrmēcĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">murmhki/as</foreign>, <sense id="n30247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a black precious stone, with protuberances like warts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 63, § 174</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrmecides: <entryFree id="n30248" type="main" key="Myrme_ci^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Myrmēcĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*murmhki/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n30248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated sculptor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 120</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 21, 21, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:43" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 5, 4, § 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrmecitis: <entryFree id="n30249" type="greek" key="myrme_ci_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrmēcītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">murmhki=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n30249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone, containing something like ants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 72, § 187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrmecium: <entryFree id="n30250" type="greek" key="myrme_ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrmēcĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">myrmēcĭon</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">murmh/kion</foreign>. <sense id="n30250.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of wart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 20, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30250.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of spider</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 27, § 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrmidone: <entryFree id="n30251" type="main" key="Myrmi^do^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Myrmĭdŏnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*murmido/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n30251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the fifty daughters of Danaüs, who killed her husband Mineus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 170" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 170</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrmidones: <entryFree id="n30252" type="main" key="Myrmi^do^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Myrmĭdŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*murmido/nes</foreign>, <sense id="n30252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Myrmidons, a people of Phthiotis</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Thessaly</hi>), <hi rend="ital">about Phthia and Larissa Cremaste, under the sway of Achilles</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 472, 27</bibl> (Trag. v. 222 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 654</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number> also as <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruentae Vulnere Myrmidonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:223" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 223</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
myrmillo: <entryFree id="n30253" type="main" key="myrmillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrmillo</orth>, v. mirmillo.</entryFree>
myrmillonica: <entryFree id="n30254" type="main" key="myrmillo_ni^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrmillōnĭca scūta</orth>, v. mirmillonicus.</entryFree>
myro: <entryFree id="n30255" type="main" key="Myro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Myro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. 1. Myron.</entryFree>
myrobalanum: <entryFree id="n30256" type="greek" key="my^ro^ba^la^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrŏbălănum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">muroba/lanon</foreign>, <sense id="n30256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fruit of a palm-tree from which a balsam was made, the behen-nut;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">the balsam itself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 21, 46, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:103" default="NO" valid="yes">12, 22, 47, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:57" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 57</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
myrobrecharius: <entryFree id="n30257" type="main" key="myro^brecha_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrŏbrechārĭus</orth>, v. murrhobathrarius.</entryFree>
myron: <entryFree id="n30258" type="main" key="Myron1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Myron</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Myro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (Gr. <sense id="n30258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen</hi>. -ōnŏs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:39:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 39, 2</bibl>, etc.), <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated sculptor of Eleutheræ in Attica, who flourished about</hi> 430 B. C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:60:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 60, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:1:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:102" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30259" type="greek" key="my^ron2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myron</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">myrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu/ron</foreign>, <sense id="n30259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ointment, unguent</hi>, pure Latin, unguentum (eccl. Lat.): myro ungere caput, Hier. praef. in Libr. Reg. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
myropola: <entryFree id="n30260" type="greek" key="my^ro^po_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrŏ-pōla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">muropw/lhs</foreign>, <sense id="n30260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dealer in ointments, essences, balsams</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">a perfumer</hi> (ante-class.), Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> 565, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myropolium: <entryFree id="n30261" type="greek" key="my^ro^po_li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrŏ-pōlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">muropw/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n30261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shop where ointments, balsams, essences</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">were sold, a perfumer's shop</hi> (Plautin.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 4, 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrothecium: <entryFree id="n30262" type="greek" key="my^ro^the_ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrŏthēcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">muroqh/kion</foreign>, <sense id="n30262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ointment-box</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrrha: <entryFree id="n30263" type="main" key="myrrha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrrha</orth>, v. 1. murra.‡ † <orth extent="full" lang="la">myrrha-</orth>, etc., v. murra-, etc.</entryFree>
myrrheus: <entryFree id="n30264" type="main" key="myrrhe^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrrhĕus</orth>, v. murreus.</entryFree>
myrrhinus: <entryFree id="n30265" type="main" key="myrrhi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrrhĭnus</orth>, v. murrinus.</entryFree>
myrrhis: <entryFree id="n30266" type="main" key="myrrhis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrrhis</orth>, v. 2. murra.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30267" type="main" key="myrrhis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrrhis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = myrtis, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:108 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 68, § 108 al.</bibl></entryFree>
myrrhites: <entryFree id="n30268" type="greek" key="myrrhi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrrhītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">murri/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n30268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone of the color of myrrh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 63, § 174</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrrhiza: <entryFree id="n30269" type="main" key="myrrhiza"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrrhiza</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <case>acc.</case> <itype>an</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = 2. murra, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 16, 97, § 154</bibl> (al. myriza).</entryFree>
myrsilus: <entryFree id="n30270" type="main" key="Myrsi_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Myrsīlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mursi=los</foreign>. <sense id="n30270.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Lydia, also called</hi> Candaules, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30270.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A historian from Lesbos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 7, 13, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 2, 22, § 65</bibl>.—Also called Myrtilus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrsineum: <entryFree id="n30271" type="hapax" key="myrsine^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrsinĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n30271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> foeniculum silvestre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 23, 96, § 255</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrsinites: <entryFree id="n30272" type="greek" key="myrsi_ni_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrsīnītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n30272.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A precious stone that smells like myrrh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 63, § 174</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30272.1" n="II" level="1"> A false reading for myrtites, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 40, § 66</bibl>. <cb n="MYRT" /></sense></entryFree>
myrta: <entryFree id="n30273" type="main" key="myrta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrta</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">murta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. myrtus.</entryFree>
myrtaceus: <entryFree id="n30274" type="main" key="myrta_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrtācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>myrtus</etym>, <sense id="n30274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of myrtle, myrtle-</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">folium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
myrtale: <entryFree id="n30275" type="main" key="Myrta^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Myrtălē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a freed-woman, a friend of Horace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 33, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrtatus: <entryFree id="n30276" type="main" key="myrta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrtātus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">murtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>myrtus</etym>, <sense id="n30276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seasoned with myrtle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">myrtleberries</hi>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">murtātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. farcimen), <hi rend="ital">a kind of pudding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">murtatum a murtā, quod ea large fartum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=110" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 110</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n30276.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of seasoning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">form myrtatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 35, § 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
myrtea: <entryFree id="n30277" type="main" key="Myrtea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Myrtea</orth>, v. Murcia.</entryFree>
myrteolus: <entryFree id="n30278" type="hapax" key="myrte^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrtĕŏlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">murtĕŏlus, myr-tĭŏlus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n30278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim</hi>. [myrteus], <hi rend="ital">of the color of myrtle-blossoms</hi>: myrteolo modo crine viret (al. murceolo, al. murciolo), Col. poët. 10, 237.</sense></entryFree>
myrteta: <entryFree id="n30279" type="main" key="myrte_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrtēta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. myrtetum.</entryFree>
myrtetum: <entryFree id="n30280" type="main" key="myrte_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrtētum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">murtētum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (collat. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">myrtēta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 625</bibl> P.) [myrtus], <sense id="n30280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place full of myrtles, a myrtle-grove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi pineis murteta item ego vos virgis circumvinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis vestitus oleastro ac murtetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 48, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora myrtetis laetissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 112</bibl></cit>.—In the neighborhood of Baiae there was such a myrtle-grove, where a warm, sudorific vapor rose from the earth, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrteus: <entryFree id="n30281" type="main" key="myrte^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrtĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">murtĕus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to myrtles, myrtle-</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30281.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrtea silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 443</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:6:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: myrtea corona (Papirius) usus est, quod Sardos in campis Myrteis superāsset, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=144" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 144</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 45, § 88</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">myr-tĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">myrtle-oil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 74, § 121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30281.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30281.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Furnished</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adorned with myrtle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:28" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30281.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Myrtle-colored, chestnutbrown</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gausapila,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30281.5" n="C" level="2"> Olea murtea, <hi rend="ital">a kind of olive-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 8, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30281.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Myrtĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess to whom the myrtle is sacred</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Venus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 36, § 121</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrtidanum: <entryFree id="n30282" type="main" key="myrti^da^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrtĭdănum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. vinum) [id.], <sense id="n30282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wine made of wild myrtle-berries, myrtlewine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrtilus: <entryFree id="n30283" type="main" key="Myrti^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Myrtĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n30283.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Mercury, slain by Pelops</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:38:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 38, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 140" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 140</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Ser. 168</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 84" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:224" default="NO">224</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30283.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Minucius Myrtilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30283.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A historian</hi>, v. Myrsilus.</sense></entryFree>
myrtinus: <entryFree id="n30284" type="main" key="myrti^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrtĭnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">murtĭnus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu/rtinos</foreign>, <sense id="n30284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to myrtles, myrtle-</hi> (post-class. for myrteus): <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 121</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
myrtiolus: <entryFree id="n30285" type="main" key="myrti^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrtĭŏlus</orth>, v. myrteolus.</entryFree>
myrtis: <entryFree id="n30286" type="main" key="myrtis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">murti/s</foreign>, <sense id="n30286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of geranium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 68, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrtites: <entryFree id="n30287" type="greek" key="myrti_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrtītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">murti/ths oi)=nos</foreign>. <sense id="n30287.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Myrtle-wine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum myrtiten sic facito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum myrtiten sic facies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30287.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A species of the plant</hi> tithymalus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 40, § 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrtopetalon: <entryFree id="n30288" type="greek" key="myrto^pe^ta^lon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrtŏ-pĕtălon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu/rtos-pe/talon</foreign>, <sense id="n30288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">myrtle-leaf, a plant, also called</hi> polygonon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 91, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrtous: <entryFree id="n30289" type="main" key="Myrto_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Myrtōus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*murtw=os</foreign>, <sense id="n30289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Myrtoan</hi>: Myrtoum mare, <hi rend="ital">the Myrtoan Sea, a part of the Ægean Sea, between Crete, the Peloponnesus, and Eubœa, which derives its name from the island of</hi> Myrtos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 14</bibl>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">pelagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:10" default="NO">2, 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:372" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 372</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
myrtum: <entryFree id="n30290" type="greek" key="myrtum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrtum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">murtum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu/rton</foreign>, <sense id="n30290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fruit of the myrtle, a myrtle-berry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruenta myrta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 306</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 35, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myrtuosus: <entryFree id="n30291" type="spur" key="myrtu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrtŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, a false read. for montuosus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 13, 28, § 48</bibl>.</entryFree>
myrtus: <entryFree id="n30292" type="greek" key="myrtus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myrtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">murtus</orth>), <itype>i and ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu/rtos</foreign>, <sense id="n30292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a myrtle, myrtle-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 37, § 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridi caput impedire myrto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">a spear of myrtle-wood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et pastoralem praefixā cuspide myrtum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:817" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 817</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Nom. plur.</hi> myrtūs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 64</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 8</bibl>.—Anteclass. also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">myrta</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">murta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">murta nigra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 125</bibl></cit>.—Murtus for <cb n="MYST" /> myrtus: <cit><quote lang="la">murti nigrae baccae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 109" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
myrus: <entryFree id="n30293" type="greek" key="my_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mȳrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu/rra</foreign>: <sense id="n30293.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">unxit se myro optimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—(But a false read. for zmyrus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 23, 39, § 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl>.)</sense></entryFree>
mys: <entryFree id="n30294" type="greek" key="mys1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mys</orth>, <itype>myos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu=s</foreign>, <sense id="n30294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-mussel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:115" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 35, 56, § 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30295" type="main" key="My_s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mȳs</orth>, <itype>Myos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mu=s</foreign>, <sense id="n30295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous artist in embossed work</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:51:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 51, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:34:1" default="NO">8, 34, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 55, § 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myscelos: <entryFree id="n30296" type="main" key="Mysce^lo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Myscĕlŏs</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the founder of the city of Croton, in Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mysia: <entryFree id="n30297" type="main" key="My_si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mȳsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*musi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n30297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a country of Asia Minor, divided into Lesser Mysia, on the Hellespont, and Greater Mysia, on the Ægean Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:18:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 40, § 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 8, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 203</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2274</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3664</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30297.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n30297.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mȳ-sĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, for Mysius, <hi rend="ital">Mysian</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">scammonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 38, § 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30297.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mȳsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mysia, Mysian</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30297.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mȳsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*muso/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mysia, Mysian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mysus juvenis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Telephus, king of Mysia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:65" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux, the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Căīcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 277</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mysus aut Phryx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 8, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:6:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 6, § 19</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mȳsi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Mysia, the Mysians</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis despicatui ducitur, ut Mysorum ultimus esse dicatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 27, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 40, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 125</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mysta: <entryFree id="n30298" type="greek" key="mysta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mysta</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mystes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu/sths</foreign>, <sense id="n30298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a priest of the secret rites of divine worship, a priest of the mysteries</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:536" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 536</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2362</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mystagogica: <entryFree id="n30299" type="greek" key="mysta^go_gi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mystăgōgĭca</orth>, <itype>ōn</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mustagwgika/</foreign>, <sense id="n30299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a treatise on initiation into the mysteries</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=363:30" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 363, 30</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
mystagogus: <entryFree id="n30300" type="greek" key="my^sta^go_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mystăgōgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mustagwgo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n30300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who conducts a person through secret and sacred places as a guide</hi>, an <hi rend="ital">initiator, a mystagogue</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:59:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 59, § 132</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae meae, te mystagogo usus, accessit,</quote> <trans><tr>the founder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 5:64" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 5, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mysterialiter: <entryFree id="n30301" type="main" key="myste_ri^a_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mystērĭālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>mysterium</etym>, <sense id="n30301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mysteriously</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Interpr. Iren. 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mysteriarches: <entryFree id="n30302" type="greek" key="myste_ri^arches"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mystērĭarches</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">musthria/rxhs</foreign>, <sense id="n30302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the presider over secret sacred rites</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 349.</sense></entryFree>
mysterium: <entryFree id="n30303" type="greek" key="myste_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mystērĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">musth/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n30303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a secret service, secret rites, secret worship</hi> of a deity, <hi rend="ital">divine mystery</hi> (class.; cf. arcanum). </sense><sense id="n30303.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of the mysteries of Ceres, otherwise called sacra Eleusinia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:24:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 24, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:14:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 14, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mysteria Attica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mysteria Cereris initiorum enuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mysteria facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to celebrate the sacred mysteries</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">the festival on which these mysteries were celebrated</hi>: in quem diem Romana incidant mysteria, <hi rend="ital">the festival of the goddess</hi> Bona Dea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 21, 14</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n30303.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a secret thing, secret, mystery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetorum mysteria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:25:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 25, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:47:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 47, 206</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistolae nostrae tantum habent mysteriorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipe congestas, mysteria frivolas nugas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 67</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30303.3" n="III" level="1"> (Eccl. Lat.) </sense><sense id="n30303.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Something transcending mere human intelligence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mysterium evangelii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mysterium sicut evangelizaverat per prophetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mysteria regni caelorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 13, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30303.5" n="2" level="3"> Of Antichrist, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 17, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mysterium iniquitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,014:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Thess. 2, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n30303.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The Lord's supper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mysterium celebrat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in 1</bibl></cit> Cor. 11, 27.</sense></entryFree>
mystes: <entryFree id="n30304" type="main" key="mystes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mystes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. mysta.</entryFree>
mystice: <entryFree id="n30305" type="main" key="mysti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mystĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mysticus <sense id="n30305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mysticus: <entryFree id="n30306" type="greek" key="mysti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mystĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mustiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n30306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to secret rites</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mysteries, mystic, mystical</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">mystica sacra Dindymenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:81:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 81, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vannus Iacchi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:1" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lampas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:765" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 765</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mystĭ-ca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">things pertaining to secret rites</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2353</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mystĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">mystically</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 7, § 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mystrum: <entryFree id="n30307" type="greek" key="mystrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mystrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu/stron</foreign>, <sense id="n30307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fourth part of a</hi> cyathus, Rhem. Fan. de Pond. et Mens. 77. <pb n="1184" /> <cb n="N" /></sense></entryFree>
mystus: <entryFree id="n30308" type="spur" key="mystus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mystus</orth>, a false read. for Nystrus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 53</bibl>.</entryFree>
mysus: <entryFree id="n30309" type="main" key="My_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mȳsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Mysia, II. C.</entryFree>
mytacismus: <entryFree id="n30310" type="main" key="my^ta^cismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mytăcismus</orth>, i. q. metacismus, q. v.</entryFree>
mythicus: <entryFree id="n30311" type="greek" key="my_thi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mȳthĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">muqiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n30311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fables</hi> or <hi rend="ital">myths, fabulous, mythic, mythical</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n30311.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, a false reading for mysticus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 184</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30311.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mȳthĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a writer of fables</hi> or <hi rend="ital">myths, a mythographer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mythistoria: <entryFree id="n30312" type="greek" key="my_thisto^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mȳthistŏrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">muqistori/a</foreign>, <sense id="n30312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabulous narrative</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Macr. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mythistoricus: <entryFree id="n30313" type="greek" key="my_thisto^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mȳthistŏrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">muqistoriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n30313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fabulous, mixed with fable</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">volumina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Firm. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mythologia: <entryFree id="n30314" type="greek" key="my_tho^lo^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mȳthŏlŏgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">muqologi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n30314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mythology</hi> (late Lat.): Mythologiarum liber, <hi rend="ital">a work of Fulgentius, in which the origin of the myths is indicated</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
mythologicus: <entryFree id="n30315" type="greek" key="my_tho^lo^gi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mȳthŏlŏgĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">muqologiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n30315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to mythology, mythological</hi> (late Lat.).—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mȳ-thŏlŏgĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">mythological matters</hi>: Mythologicōn liber, <hi rend="ital">the title of a work of Fulgentius, also called</hi> Mythologiarum liber, v. mythologia.</sense></entryFree>
mythos: <entryFree id="n30316" type="greek" key="my_tho^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mȳthŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu=qos</foreign>, <sense id="n30316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fable, myth</hi> (late Lat. for fabula): callentes mython (<hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mu/qwn</foreign>), plasmata, Aus. ap. Prof. Carm. 21, v. 26.</sense></entryFree>
mytilene: <entryFree id="n30317" type="main" key="My^ti^le_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mytĭlēnē</orth> (in later times <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭtylēnē</orth>), <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mytĭlēnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mutilh/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n30317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the capital of Lesbos, the birthplace of Sappho, Pittacus, Alcæus, and Diophanes, the orator</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Mytilini</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Castro</hi>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Mytilene: laudabunt alii claram Rhodon, aut Mytilenen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 17 al.</bibl>—In <number>plur.</number> form, Mytilenae: <cit><quote lang="la">Mytilenis an Rhodi malles vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:16:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 16, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:102:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 102, 5</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n30317.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mytĭlēnaeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Mĭty-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mitulhnaios</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*mutilhnai/os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mytilene, Mytilenean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mango,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:80:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 80, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Theophanes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">My-tĭlēnaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. incolae), <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Mytilene, the Mytileneans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:18:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 18, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30317.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mytĭlēnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mytilene</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mytilus: <entryFree id="n30318" type="main" key="my_ti^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mȳtĭlus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mȳtŭlus</orth>, v. mitulus.</entryFree>
myus: <entryFree id="n30319" type="main" key="Myu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Myūs</orth>, <itype>untis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*muou=s</foreign>, <sense id="n30319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Caria, on the southern shore of the Meander, the smallest of the cities of the Ionian League</hi>, now the ruins of <hi rend="ital">Palatsha</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
myxa: <entryFree id="n30320" type="greek" key="myxa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">myxa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu/ca</foreign>. <sense id="n30320.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of plum-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 5, 10, § 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30320.1" n="II" level="1"> = rostrum, <hi rend="ital">the curved part of a lamp, nozzle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:41:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 41, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
