default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 376</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30390.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The nose</hi>, as an organ expressive of sagacity, and also of scorn and anger: <cit><quote lang="la">naribus ducere tura,</quote> <trans><tr>to smell</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: naribus labrisque non fere quicquam decenter ostendimus, tametsi derisus iis, contemptus, fastidium significari solet, nam et corrugare nares, ut Horatius ait ... indecorum <cb n="NARR" /> est, etc., <hi rend="ital">to turn up the nose, to sneer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sordida mappa Corruget nares,</quote> <trans><tr>cause you to turn up your nose</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis copia narium,</quote> <trans><tr>sweet-smelling flowers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de nare loqui,</quote> <trans><tr>to speak through the nose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:33" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 33</bibl></cit>: Aesopus naris emunctae senex, <hi rend="ital">of a clean nose</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of sharp perception, of fine powers of observation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 3, 14</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">(Lucilius) emunctae naris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acutae nares,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and on the contrary: homo naris obesae,</quote> <trans><tr>of a dull nose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 12, 3</bibl></cit>: naribus uti, <hi rend="ital">to turn up the nose</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to banter, ridicule</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 45</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rides et nimis uncis naribus indulges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:41" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 41</bibl></cit>.—Of anger: Calpurni saevam legem Pisoni' reprendi, Eduxique animam in prioribu' naribus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 427, 32</bibl> (Sat. 20, 4): <cit><quote lang="la">in naribus primoribus vix pertuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:ib. 33" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> ib. 33</bibl></cit> (Com. Rel. v. 384 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n30390.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an opening, orifice, vent, air-hole</hi>, of a canal, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter duos parietes canalis ducatur, habens nares ad locum patentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 9, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
naristi: <entryFree id="n30391" type="main" key="Naristi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Naristi</orth> (v. l. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Varisti</orth>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Varis-tae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. Phil. 22, 1</bibl>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Germany, part of the Suevi, near the Hermundurians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 42</bibl>; Cap. Marc. Aur. 22.</sense></entryFree>
narita: <entryFree id="n30392" type="greek" key="na_ri_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nārīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nhri/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n30392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sea-snail</hi>, Plaut. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=166" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 166</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
naritas: <entryFree id="n30393" type="hapax" key="na_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nārĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>narus for gnarus; cf. gnaritas</etym>, <sense id="n30393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">knowledge, discernment;</hi> nares a naritate dictae sunt, Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
narnia: <entryFree id="n30394" type="main" key="Narni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Narnĭa</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Umbrian city on the Nar</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Narni</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:15" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 9</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30394.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Narnĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Narnia, Narnian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 4, 28, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 50</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sc. ager),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Narnĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Narnia, the Narnians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
naro: <entryFree id="n30395" type="main" key="Na^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Năro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Dalmatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 22, 26, § 143</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
narona: <entryFree id="n30396" type="main" key="Naro_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Narōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Dalmatia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Opus</hi>, Mela, 2, 3, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 22, 26, § 142</bibl>; Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ib. 13, 77, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
narrabilis: <entryFree id="n30397" type="main" key="narra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">narrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>narro</etym>, <sense id="n30397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be narrated</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:61" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
narratio: <entryFree id="n30398" type="main" key="narra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">narrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a relating, narrating, a narration, narrative</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30398.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">narrationes credibiles, nec historico, sed prope cotidiano sermone explicatae dilucide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:124" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 26, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem narrare ita ut verisimilis narratio sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si exponenda est narratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:62:210" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 62, 210</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 5, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30398.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in rhet.: <cit><quote lang="la">narratio est rerum gestarum, aut ut gesta rum, expositio: narrationum genera sunt tria, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:19:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 19, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:9:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 9, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 8, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 550</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
narratiuncula: <entryFree id="n30399" type="main" key="narra_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">narrātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>narratio</etym>, <sense id="n30399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small, short narrative</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 33, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
narrative: <entryFree id="n30400" type="main" key="narra_ti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">narrātīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>narro</etym>, <sense id="n30400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the way of narration</hi>, Don. ad Ter. argum. And.</sense></entryFree>
narrativus: <entryFree id="n30401" type="main" key="narra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">narrātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suitable for narration</hi>, Empor. Rhet. de Loco Comm. p. 567, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">principium (Aeneidos),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
narrator: <entryFree id="n30402" type="main" key="narra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">narrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a relater, narrator, historian</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">narratores faceti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disertus rerum suarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a narratoribus oratoribusque praecipua materia in laudem principis adsumta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
narratum: <entryFree id="n30403" type="main" key="narra_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">narrātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. narro <sense id="n30403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
narratus: <entryFree id="n30404" type="main" key="narra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">narrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. narro.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30405" type="main" key="narra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">narrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>narro</etym>, <sense id="n30405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a narration, narrative</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">veniet narratibus hora Tempestiva meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 499</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 230, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
narro: <entryFree id="n30406" type="main" key="narro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">narro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>for gnarigo (gnarigavit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=95" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 95</bibl>) from gnarus; Sanscr. gnā, know; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gignw/skw</foreign>; cf.: nosco (gnosco), ignoro</etym>, <sense id="n30406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tell, relate, narrate, report, recount, set forth</hi> (syn.: memoro, nuntio, trado). </sense><sense id="n30406.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mihi istaec narras?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego tibi ea narro quae tu melius scis, quam ipse, qui narro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">garrula pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1187" /> <cb n="NARY" /> 82.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi Philargyrus narravit, te interdum sollicitum esse vehementius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clitarchus tibi narravit Darium ab Alexandro esse superatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne narres te sudavisse ferendo Carmina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrare virtutem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibos suos homini narrabimus,</quote> <trans><tr>set forth, explain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrat, ut virgo ab se integra etiam tum siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 70</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ita narrentur ut gestae res erunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:20:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 20, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec inter paucos palam secreto narrantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in comoediis res ipsa narratur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae in provinciis facta narrabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:76" default="NO">4, 2, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes ... satis narratas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 11</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā (epistulā) Crassi libertum ais tibi de meā sollicitudine macieque narrāsse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores ejus, de quo narres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quibus nos narrabimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 14, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. in the foll.: male, bene narrare, <hi rend="ital">to tell bad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">good news</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">male narras de Nepotis filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Othonem quod speras posse vinci, sane bene narras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 33, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">quid istaec tabellae narrant?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si res publica tibi narrare posset, quomodo sese haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ejus oratio de animo tuo, de sermonibus, quos de me haberes cotidie, mihi narraret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: narratur and narrant, <hi rend="ital">it is said, they say</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paridis propter narratur amorem Graecia Barbariae lento collisa duello,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">versiculos in me narratur scribere Cinna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:9:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; but narratur with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> is rare: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc Chamavos et Angrivarios immigrāsse narratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 33 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eoque terrore aves tunc siluisse narratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 28, § 121</bibl></cit> (Jan. narrantque; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Zumpt, Gram. § 607): narrant, et in Ponto Caecian in se trahere nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 48, § 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:236" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 106, 110, § 236</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:75" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 7, 24, § 75</bibl> et saep.: narror, narraris = narratur de me, de te, <hi rend="ital">to be the subject of talk, it is said</hi> of me, thee, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">rideor ubique, narror, ostendor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 14:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 14, 12 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcis in Elysio narraris fabula campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:52:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 52, 5</bibl></cit>: Sibi narrare, <hi rend="ital">to inform one's self, learn</hi>: Cape has tabellas; <cit><quote lang="la">tute hinc narrato tibi, quae me miseria contabefecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30406.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to say, speak, tell</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">narra, quid est, quid ait?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego quid narres nescio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non possum satis narrare quos ludos praebueris intus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum distet ab Inacho Codrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 3</bibl></cit>.— Hence, narro tibi, <hi rend="ital">I tell you, I assure you, in fact, seriously</hi>, a form of asseveration: <cit><quote lang="la">narro tibi: plane relegatus mihi videor, postea quam in Formiano sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narro tibi, haec loca venusta sunt, abdita certe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 16</bibl></cit>, B; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 21, 1: navita de ventis, de tauris narrat arator,</quote> <trans><tr>talks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:43" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne res per quemquam narraretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9:19" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 9, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30406.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to dedicate</hi>: librum alicui, Plin. praef. § 1.—Hence, <pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">narrātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is told</hi> or <hi rend="ital">narrated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quoque, Tiresia, praeter narrata petenti Responde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
narseus: <entryFree id="n30407" type="main" key="Narseus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Narseus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕos</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Narses</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Persian king</hi>, Junand. Reb. Get. 21; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nartes: <entryFree id="n30408" type="main" key="Nartes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nartes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. 2, Nar.</entryFree>
narthecia: <entryFree id="n30409" type="greek" key="narthe_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">narthēcĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">narthēcya</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n30409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">narqhki/a</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">narqhku/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a low species of</hi> ferula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 42, § 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
narthecium: <entryFree id="n30410" type="greek" key="narthe_ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">narthēcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">narqh/kion</foreign> (lit. a piece of narthex-wood which has been hollowed out for keeping ointments and medicines in; <sense id="n30410.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">hence any vessel in which these articles are kept),</quote> <trans><tr>an ointment-box, a medicine-chest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:78:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 78, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam doloris medicamenta illa Epicurea tamquam de narthecio proment,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 7, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
narthex: <entryFree id="n30411" type="greek" key="narthex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">narthex</orth>, <itype>ēcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o( na/rqhc</foreign>, <sense id="n30411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the shrub</hi> ferula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 42, § 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
narus: <entryFree id="n30412" type="gloss" key="na_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nārus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. gnarus <sense id="n30412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
narycia: <entryFree id="n30413" type="main" key="Na_ry^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nārycĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the city of Locri, founded in Lower Italy by the Ozolian Locrians</hi> (from Narycion), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 705</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
narycion: <entryFree id="n30414" type="main" key="Na_ry^ci^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nārycĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*naru/kion</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 12, § 27</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nāryx</orth>, <itype>ycis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*na/ruc</foreign>,<cb n="NASC" />  <sense id="n30414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of the Ozolian Locrians</hi>, a colony from which built the city of Locri, in Italy, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 12, § 27</bibl> (Jan. Narycum).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nārycĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*naru/kios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Narycion</hi> (the birthplace of Ajax Oïleus), <hi rend="ital">Narycian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic et Narycii posuerunt moenia Locri (cf. Narycion),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 438</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lelex,</quote> <trans><tr>a king of the Locrians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the son of Ajax Oïleus, who led the colony of Locrians to Italy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:468" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 468</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nasamon: <entryFree id="n30415" type="main" key="Na^sa^mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Năsămon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, cf. Nasamones.</entryFree>
nasamones: <entryFree id="n30416" type="main" key="Na^sa^mo_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Năsămōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nasamw=nes</foreign>, <sense id="n30416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Libyan people to the south-west of Cyrenaica, extending to the Great Syrtis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 2, 2, § 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:104" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 17, 23, § 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota commercia mundo Naufragiis Nasamones habent (because they plundered shipwrecked persons),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 443</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">sing., a Nasamonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (herbas) Nasamon, gens dura, legit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 439</bibl></cit>; <case>acc.</case> Nasamona, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:44" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 44</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30416.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Năsămōnĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Nasamonian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:630" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 630</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 129</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30416.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">African</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Hannibal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:75" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 75</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30416.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Năsămōnĭăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nasamwnia/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Nasamonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nasamonias Harpe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:117" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 117</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30416.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Năsămōnītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nasamwni=tis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 64, § 175</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30416.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nă-sămōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Nasamonian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">African</hi>: natus Nasamonii Tonantis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Alexander</hi>, because he passed for the son of Jupiter Ammon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:7:93" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 7, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jugurtha,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 257</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nascens: <entryFree id="n30417" type="main" key="nascens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nascens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from nascor.</entryFree>
nascentia: <entryFree id="n30418" type="main" key="nascenti^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nascentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nascor</etym>, <sense id="n30418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">birth</hi> (Vitruv.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n30419" type="main" key="nascenti^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nascentĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. nascor, II. <pos>P. a.</pos> A. 2.</entryFree>
nascibilis: <entryFree id="n30420" type="main" key="nasci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nascĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nascor</etym>, <sense id="n30420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be born</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nascio: <entryFree id="n30421" type="main" key="Nasci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nascĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of birth;</hi> v. natio, <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>, I.</sense></entryFree>
nasco: <entryFree id="n30422" type="main" key="nasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. nascor <sense id="n30422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nascor: <entryFree id="n30423" type="main" key="nascor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nascor</orth>, <itype>nātus, nasci</itype> (ante-class., and in poets of the class. period also gnatus, v. under <pos>P. a.</pos> B.; <sense id="n30423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. fut.</hi> nasciturus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 7, § 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 13, 8</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>from gnascor, gnatus, root gen, whence gigno; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">genna/w</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to be born, to be begotten</hi> (of or by male or female). </sense><sense id="n30423.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>; constr. with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> or <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, or with <case>abl.</case> alone; rarely with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case> </sense><sense id="n30423.2" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> and <case>abl.</case> (esp. with name or other appellation of the mother): <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex utrāque (uxore) filius natus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus ex filiā natus est Sestius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Servius Tullius ex serva Tarquiniensi natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:21:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 21, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hac feminā debuit nasci, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Helv. 16:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Helv. 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natam sibi ex Poppaeā filiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 23 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Thetide natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Urbiniā natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandri filius natus ex Barsine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:2:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">negantis (Domitii) quidquam ex se et Agrippinā nisi detestabile nasci potuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ex nobis natos liberos appellamus, idcirco Cerere nati nominati sunt Liber et Libera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:24:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 24, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">convinces facile ex te esse natum, nam tui similis est probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex militibus Romanis et Hispanis mulieribus natos se memorantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">very rarely with a designation of the father, and only with pronouns: ex hoc Domitius nascitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neoptolemus ex quo nata est Olympias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:3:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo nasci nepotes deceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum ex me natum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 10</bibl></cit> ext. 3; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tibi filiolus vel filia nascitur ex me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:83" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30423.3" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tigride natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 612</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de stirpe dei nasci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:312" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pellice natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:422" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 422</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natus de muliere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 14</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n30423.4" n="3" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case> (so usually with proper names; <cit><quote lang="la">and with general designations of parents, family, etc.): quos omnes Erebo et Nocte natos ferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hercules Jove natus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilo natus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nascetur Oedipus Lao,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:13:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patre Marte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 33, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privignus Poppaeā natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ascanius Creusā matre natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: Junia, <cb n="NASC" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:127:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 127, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimā familiā nati adulescentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestis parentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 7:21:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 7, 21, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mela quibus Gallio et Seneca parentibus natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus deo natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperioso patre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 1, 12</bibl>: Assaraco natus Capus, Enn. ap. Philarg. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 35</bibl> (Ann. v. 31 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">patre certo nasci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apolline natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 639</bibl></cit>: natus deā, <hi rend="ital">son of a goddess</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Achilles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 86</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">natus deā,</quote> <trans><tr>of Æneas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 582</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matre Musā natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nascetur pulcrā Trojanus origine Caesar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 286</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30423.5" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">generari et nasci a principibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et qui nascentur ab illo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 434</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30423.6" n="5" level="3"> In other constrr.: <cit><quote lang="la">post homines natos,</quote> <trans><tr>since men have lived</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post genus hominum natum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in miseriam nascimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves omnes in pedes nascuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>with the feet foremost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 53, 74, § 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad homines nascendos vim hujus numeri (septenarii) pertinere,</quote> <trans><tr>to the formation of man in the womb</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo nascitur ad laborem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>it is his nature to suffer it</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30423.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to rise, take beginning, derive origin, spring forth, grow, be found</hi>: O fortunatam natam me consule Romam, Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 24</bibl>; and ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:122" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humi nascentia fraga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum nata fuerint folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 13, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nascitur ibi plumbum album in mediterraneis regionibus,</quote> <trans><tr>is found, produced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onyx nascitur circa Thebas Aegyptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 8, 12, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex palude nascitur amnis,</quote> <trans><tr>rises</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 26, 65, § 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nascere, praeque diem veniens age, Lucifer, almum,</quote> <trans><tr>rise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde nigerrimus Auster Nascitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nascens luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nascentia templa,</quote> <trans><tr>newly built</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:4:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Circaeis nata forent an Lucrinum ad saxum ... ostrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:140" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 140</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">To rise, be formed</hi> (of a hill): <cit><quote lang="la">ab eo flumine collis nascebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nascitur altera moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:530" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 530</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n30423.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30423.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To arise, spring forth, proceed from, be produced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribes ad me, ut mihi nascatur epistulae argumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla tam detestabilis pestis est, quae non homini ab homine nascatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fateor ea me studiose secutum ex quibus vera gloria nasci posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus natum a cupiditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:34:section=82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 34, § 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 16, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">visus ei dicitur draco ... dicere quo illa loci nasceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:66:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 66, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strumae nascuntur maxime in cervice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 12, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 7, 6, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">onychem in Arabiae tantum montibus nasci putavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 7, 12, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta nata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:63:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 63, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo uno haec omnia nata et profecta esse concedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 28, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agr 2, 33, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">profectio nata a timore defectionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querelae verae nascuntur pectore ab imo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis obligatio vel ex contractu nascitur vel ex delicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:88 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 88 sq.</bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hoc nascitur ut,</quote> <trans><tr>hence it follows that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30423.10" n="B" level="2"> Esp., of the spiritual renewal of a religious experience, <hi rend="ital">to be regenerated, born again</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod natum est ex spiritu, spiritus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nasci denuo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natus ex Deo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Johan. 3, 9, etc.—Hence, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n30423.11" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nascens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">arising, beginning, nascent, infant, immature</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante Periclem et Thucydidem, qui non nascentibus Athenis, sed jam adultis fuerunt, littera nulla est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:7:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiam pueris induunt adhuc nascentibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vitulus) vexat nascenti robora cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:9" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30423.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nascentia</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">organic bodies</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">plants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 8, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30423.13" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., born;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n30423.14" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">gnātus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a son;</hi> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">nāta</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">gnāta</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<case>dat.</case> and <hi rend="ital">abl. pl.</hi> natabus, where ambiguity is to be avoided, Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 733</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 7421</bibl>; Phocas, p. 1707 P.; v. Neue, Formenl. 1, p. 29), <hi rend="ital">a daughter;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>: nati (gnati), <hi rend="ital">children, offspring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caritas, quae est inter natos et parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum prope inter parentes natosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 23, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 40, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pecore et gnatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et trepidae matres pressere ad pectora natos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 518</bibl></cit>: mihi ausculta, nate, pueros jube cremarier, Enn. <pb n="1188" /> <cb n="NASI" /> ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 246, 11</bibl> (Trag. v. 329 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">natam conlocare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:Arg. 1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. Arg. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: o gnata, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 46 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">si quis gnatam pro mutā devovet agnā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 219</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 199</bibl>: Hectoris natum de muro jactarier, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=70" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 70</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 130 Vahl.); so, Nerei natae, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 733</bibl> P. (Trag. v. 135 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">maxima natarum Priami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 654</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 661</bibl>.—Esp. in the phrase natus nemo, <hi rend="ital">not a human being, nobody</hi> (Plautine for nemo mortalis): <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam si natus nemo in aedibus habitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 55</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad loc.; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nato nemini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30423.15" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n30423.16" n="a" level="4"> Natus alicui rei or ad aliquam rem, <hi rend="ital">born, made, destined, designed, intended, produced by nature</hi> for any thing. </sense><sense id="n30423.17" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">me credo huic esse natum rei, ferundis miseriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sibi se soli natum meminerit, sed patriae, sed suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natus huic imperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 24, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gurges atque helluo natus abdomini suo, non laudi atque gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Judaei et Syri, nationes natae servituti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 5, 10</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n30423.18" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vir ad omnia summa natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:239" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 68, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natus ad haec tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad dicendum natus aptusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haudem et ad decus nati, suscepti, instituti sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hoc unum natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 28, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad cursum equus, ad arandum bos, ad indagandum canis, sic homo ad intellegendum et agendum natus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natus ad sacra Cithaeron,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canor mulcendas natus ad aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:561" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 561</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30423.19" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quid meruere boves, animal ... natum tolerare labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 120</bibl></cit>: sentes tantummodo laedere natae, id. de Nuce, 113.—</sense><sense id="n30423.20" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nati in usum laetitiae scyphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 99</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 117</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">propter</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">apros, animal propter convivia natum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:141" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 141</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30423.21" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Formed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">constituted by nature</hi> in any manner: <cit><quote lang="la">alius ager bene natus, alius male,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarmenta male nata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita natus locus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inculti versūs et male nati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 233</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30423.22" n="(b)" level="5"> Pro re natā, or (ante- and post-class.) e re natā, <hi rend="ital">under the present circumstances, according to the state of affairs, as matters are</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in his pro re natā non incommode possint esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antonii colloquium cum heroibus nostris pro re natā non incommodum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 8, 2: e re natā melius fieri haud potuit, quam factum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 143, 38</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n30423.23" n="c" level="4"> With a specification of time, <hi rend="ital">so old, of the age of</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">eques Romanus annos prope XC. natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annos natus unum et viginti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:20:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 20, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum annos ad quinquaginta natus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:40:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 40, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quinque et viginti natus annos dominatum occupavisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato annos quinque et octoginta natus excessit e vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:20:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 20, 80</bibl></cit>; in inscr. ANNORVM NATVS, etc., Inscr. Mon. Scip. n. 7; <cit><quote lang="la">Inscr. Marini Atti, p. 564.— Sometimes, in order to specify the age more exactly, major or minor, without or with quam, is added: annos nata est sedecim non major,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minor quinque et viginti annis natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,023:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Han. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minor triginta annis natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:49:section=122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 49, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo annos natus major quadraginta,</quote> <trans><tr>over forty years old</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:14:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysius major annos sexaginta natus decessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum liberis majoribus quam quindecim annos natis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minorem quam annos sex, majorem quam annos decem natam, negarunt capi fas esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—For major, minor, sometimes with <hi rend="ital">plus, minus</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">plus triginta annis natus sim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annos sexaginta natus es aut plus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non amplius novem annos natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,023:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Han. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <hi rend="ital">to be born</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi germen nascere coeperit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 151 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
nasica: <entryFree id="n30424" type="main" key="na_si_ca1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nāsīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n30424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comm. adj.</hi> [nasus], <hi rend="ital">who has a large</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pointed nose</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 196</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30425" type="main" key="Na_si_ca2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nāsīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the Scipio family</hi>. So P. Cornelius Scipio Nasica, <hi rend="ital">who was declared to be the most virtuous<cb n="NASU" />  man in the state, and on that account was sent to accompany the image of the</hi> Mater Idaea <hi rend="ital">to Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 14, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:20:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 20, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nasidianus: <entryFree id="n30426" type="main" key="Na_si^di^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nāsĭdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Nasidius <sense id="n30426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nasidienus: <entryFree id="n30427" type="main" key="Na_si_di^e_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nāsīdĭēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30427.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A wealthy upstart in the time of Horace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 1 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n30427.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:54" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nasidius: <entryFree id="n30428" type="main" key="Na_si^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nāsĭdĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n30428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n30428.1" n="1" level="3"> L. Nasidius, <hi rend="ital">a Roman knight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 8, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30428.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An adherent of Pompey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 17, 3</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nā-sĭdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Nasidian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nasiterna: <entryFree id="n30429" type="main" key="na_si^terna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nāsĭterna</orth>, etc., v. nassiterna, etc.</entryFree>
naso: <entryFree id="n30430" type="main" key="Na_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nāso</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n30430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">amplif.</hi> [nasus, largenosed], <hi rend="ital">a Roman family name in the Otacilian, Octavian, Ovidian, and Voconian</hi> gentes. So esp., P. Ovidius Naso, <hi rend="ital">the poet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio perii Naso poëta meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:74" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nasos: <entryFree id="n30431" type="main" key="Na_sos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nāsos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nāsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*na=sos, *nh=sos</foreign> (the island), <sense id="n30431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a part of the city of Syracuse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 30, 9</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
nassa: <entryFree id="n30432" type="main" key="nassa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nassa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">naxa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>no</etym>, <sense id="n30432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wickerbasket with a narrow neck, for catching fish, a weel</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30432.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: nassa est piscatorii vasi genus, quo, cum intravit piscis, exire non potest, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=169" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 169</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:47" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 37, 61, § 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">junci usus ad nassas marinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 18, 59, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scarus inclusus nassis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 2, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>: instrumento piscatoris legato, et retia et nassae ... debentur. <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 66</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30432.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of a dangerous place, <hi rend="ital">a snare, net</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam ex istā nassā escam petam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hac naxā exire constitui, non ad fugam, sed ad spem mortis melioris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclusus carcere nassae (aeger),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:123" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 123</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nassiterna: <entryFree id="n30433" type="main" key="nassi^terna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nassĭterna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nāsĭt-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nasus</etym>, <sense id="n30433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large watering-pot with a large nose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spout</hi>: nassiterna est genus vasi aquarii ansati et patentis, quale est quo equi perfundi solent, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=169" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 169</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 546, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nassiternatus: <entryFree id="n30434" type="hapax" key="nassi^terna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nassĭternātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>nassiterna</etym>, <sense id="n30434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">provided with a large-nosed watering-pot</hi>, Calp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> in Expos. Serm. Antiq. p. 563, 31</bibl> Merc.</sense></entryFree>
nasturtium: <entryFree id="n30435" type="main" key="nasturti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nasturtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>nasi-tortium</etym>, <sense id="n30435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of cress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nasturtium nomen accepit a narium tormento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 44, § 155</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 13, 50, § 127</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Persas) negat Xenophon ad panem adhibere quicquam praeter nasturtium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 99</bibl></cit>; <usg type="style">poet.</usg> in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> M. 84</bibl>; Col. poët. 10, 231.</sense></entryFree>
nasus: <entryFree id="n30436" type="main" key="na_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nāsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (ante - class. <itype>nasum, i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: quīs oculi non sunt neque nasum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 215, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 288</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 41</bibl>), <sense id="n30436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the nose</hi> (syn nares). </sense><sense id="n30436.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nasus ita locatus est, ut quasi murus oculis interjectus esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:143" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abripere alicui nasum mordicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naso exhibere molestiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naso clamare magnum,</quote> <trans><tr>to snore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collisus nasus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:22:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pravus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congelati gutta nasi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:98:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 98, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">madidique infantia nasi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:199" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exprimere rorantem frigore nasum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:37:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingeminant geminos naso crispante cachinnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:87" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tibi displicuit tuus nasus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:495" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilanti stertere naso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30436.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The nose</hi>, as the seat of quick smell; and also the feature whereby anger or scorn is expressed; cf. naris (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">rancidum aprum antiqui laudabant, non quia nasus Illis nullus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 89</bibl></cit>.—Of anger: <cit><quote lang="la">disce sed ira cadat naso, rugosaque sanna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:91" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:64:28" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 64, 28</bibl>.—Of scorn, derision, satirical wit, satire, sarcasm: <cit><quote lang="la">naso adunco aliquem suspendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Balatro suspendens omnia naso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucilius, qui primus condidit stili nasum, Plin. N. H. praef. § 8: non cuicumque datum est habere nasum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:42:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 42, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacito ridere naso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:19:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 19, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenesque senesque et pueri nasum rhinocerotis habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30436.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, the projecting part of a vessel, <hi rend="ital">the nozzle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spout</hi> (cf. nassiterna): <cit><quote lang="la">calix nasorum quatuor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:46" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:96" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
